Spanish Chapter Name: Examinando la Evidencia del Cambio Climático
ChapterDescription: Students begin this unit by playing the Carbon Command game which helps them to understand the negative impacts of increasing carbon dioxide levels in the oceans and the atmosphere. A message from the Green Ninja introduces the unit challenge of designing a climate-friendly home. Students then take a pre-assessment to assess their prior knowledge of climate, temperature, and energy concepts. They review their pre-assessment and reflect on their understanding of the core ideas of the unit. They also engage in a data analysis activity to explore evidence of climate change.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In the Green Ninja program, our first unit begins with a challenge to design a climate-friendly home. This challenge offers us the opportunity to apply creativity and critical thinking towards reducing our carbon footprint. The initial chapter introduces the impacts of increasing carbon dioxide levels in our oceans and atmosphere, utilizing the interactive game Carbon Command. We also explore real-world evidence of climate change through data analysis. This examination lets us understand the significant effects of human activities on our planet and the need for sustainable actions. This study lays the groundwork for our exploration of climate, temperature, and energy concepts as we progress through the unit. Let’s go!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En el programa Green Ninja, nuestra primera unidad comienza con un desafío para diseñar una casa amigable con el clima. Este desafío nos ofrece la oportunidad de aplicar la creatividad y el pensamiento crítico para reducir nuestra huella de carbono. El primer capítulo presenta los impactos del aumento de los niveles de dióxido de carbono en nuestros océanos y atmósfera, utilizando el juego interactivo Carbon Command. También exploramos evidencia del mundo real del cambio climático a través del análisis de datos. Este examen nos permite comprender los efectos significativos de las actividades humanas en nuestro planeta y la necesidad de acciones sostenibles. Este estudio sienta las bases para nuestra exploración de los conceptos de clima, temperatura y energía a medida que avanzamos en la unidad. ¡Vamos!

ChapterDescription: Students delve deeper into the topic of Earth's changing climate and specifically focus on understanding temperature. They engage in discussions and hands-on activities to explore the relationship between temperature and energy. Using an online simulation, students further investigate models of how temperature relates to the total energy of particles in a substance. Short investigations help to develop an understanding of thermal energy transfer. The chapter ends with a formative assessment to gauge the students’ comprehension of thermal energy transfer.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter delves into the complex connection between temperature and energy, exploring the intricate world of thermal energy transfer. Our investigation encompasses key concepts such as conduction, convection, and radiation, enhancing our understanding of how temperature influences the behavior of substances. We employ an online simulation as our virtual laboratory, which allows us to investigate the energy states of particles in different substances and observe the effects of varying temperatures. Understanding thermal energy transfer is crucial as we continue to learn about Earth's changing climate and the contributing factors.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo profundiza en la compleja conexión entre temperatura y energía, explorando el intrincado mundo de la transferencia de energía térmica. Nuestra investigación abarca conceptos clave como la conducción, la convección y la radiación, mejorando nuestra comprensión de cómo la temperatura influye en el comportamiento de las sustancias. Utilizamos una simulación en línea como nuestro laboratorio virtual, lo que nos permite investigar los estados de energía de las partículas en diferentes sustancias y observar los efectos de las temperaturas variables. Comprender la transferencia de energía térmica es crucial a medida que seguimos aprendiendo sobre el cambio climático de la Tierra y los factores que contribuyen a él.

ChapterDescription: Students begin the chapter by taking a quiz to assess their understanding of the core ideas related to temperature and energy transfer. They then engage in a demonstration and read an article that provides information about the greenhouse effect. Students participate in a play assuming different roles representing components of the greenhouse effect. This helps them make the connection between increasing carbon dioxide levels and rising global temperatures. Students collaborate to design an investigation to determine the impact of carbon dioxide on temperature.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter provides robust exploration of the greenhouse effect, an essential factor in Earth's temperature. We engage in a demonstration and scientific investigation studying the relationship between carbon dioxide and temperature. Further learning occurs through reading materials, and a play elucidating the greenhouse effect's operation on Earth. Subsequently, we compare Earth’s temperature with that of Venus, utilizing our new knowledge to explain the difference. This chapter is a vital part of our journey in understanding climate and designing a climate-friendly home.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo proporciona una exploración sólida del efecto invernadero, un factor esencial en la temperatura de la Tierra. Participamos en una demostración e investigación científica que estudia la relación entre el dióxido de carbono y la temperatura. El aprendizaje adicional ocurre a través de materiales de lectura y una obra que aclara el funcionamiento del efecto invernadero en la Tierra. Posteriormente, comparamos la temperatura de la Tierra con la de Venus, utilizando nuestro nuevo conocimiento para explicar la diferencia. Este capítulo es una parte vital de nuestro viaje para comprender el clima y diseñar una casa amigable con el clima.

ChapterDescription: Students now revisit the Carbon Command game, focusing on understanding how energy moves through various Earth systems. Polar bear habitat loss is investigated, and the interconnectedness of Earth's systems is explored through different scenarios. Students answer questions and share their knowledge about how energy and matter transfer between Earth's systems. To consolidate their understanding, students create an Earth Systems Super Poster to visually represent how energy and matter move between Earth's spheres.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter investigates the interconnected nature of Earth's systems and the intricate impacts they exert on each other. We focus on how energy flows through these systems, using the example of polar bear habitat loss to illustrate the balance of life on Earth. From climate to weather patterns, ocean currents to ecosystems, we examine the complex interactions within Earth's spheres. This chapter culminates in creating an Earth Systems Super Poster, visually representing the flow of energy and matter through these spheres, forming a comprehensive understanding of Earth's dynamic systems.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo investiga la naturaleza interconectada de los sistemas de la Tierra y los impactos intrincados que ejercen en cada uno. Nos enfocamos en cómo fluye la energía a través de estos sistemas, utilizando el ejemplo de la pérdida de hábitat del oso polar para ilustrar el equilibrio de la vida en la Tierra. Desde el clima hasta los patrones meteorológicos, las corrientes oceánicas hasta los ecosistemas, examinamos las complejas interacciones dentro de las esferas de la Tierra. Este capítulo culmina en la creación de un Super Póster de los Sistemas Terrestres, representando visualmente el flujo de energía y materia a través de estas esferas, formando una comprensión integral de los sistemas dinámicos de la Tierra.

ChapterDescription: Factors contributing to changes in Earth's climate, specifically the rise in global temperatures, are now considered. Students formulate scientific questions and distinguish between natural and anthropogenic factors impacting climate change. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 provides a chance to check on student understanding. Students play the Carbon Command game once more. Following a video about carbon footprints, students analyze their own energy usage, and create public service announcement posters educating others on ways to lower their carbon footprint.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter transforms us into climate detectives, taking us deeper into the world of climate change. We guide our exploration with scientific questions, investigating the different factors affecting climate change and distinguishing between natural causes and those caused by human activities. We watch a video about carbon footprints, analyze our own energy usage, and explore sustainable practices for daily life. Finally, we design posters to inspire others in the fight against climate change.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo nos convierte en detectives del clima, llevándonos más profundamente al mundo del cambio climático. Guiamos nuestra exploración con preguntas científicas, investigando los diferentes factores que afectan el cambio climático y distinguiendo entre causas naturales y aquellas causadas por actividades humanas. Vemos un video sobre huellas de carbono, analizamos nuestro propio uso de energía y exploramos prácticas sostenibles para la vida diaria. Finalmente, diseñamos carteles para inspirar a otros en la lucha contra el cambio climático.

Spanish Chapter Name: Minimizando la Transferencia de Energía Térmica
ChapterDescription: Students share their carbon footprint public service announcements through a gallery walk. They then shift their attention to reducing home energy usage by focusing on minimizing thermal energy transfer. Students plan and carry out investigations to determine if certain materials can effectively prevent thermal energy from transferring into containers.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This concise chapter emphasizes reducing home energy usage by minimizing thermal energy transfer. We plan investigations to examine different materials for their effectiveness in preventing thermal energy transfer into containers. The results from these investigations will aid in preparing for the unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo conciso enfatiza la reducción del uso de energía en el hogar al minimizar la transferencia de energía térmica. Planeamos investigaciones para examinar diferentes materiales por su efectividad en prevenir la transferencia de energía térmica en los contenedores. Los resultados de estas investigaciones ayudarán a prepararnos para el desafío de la unidad.

Spanish Chapter Name: Diseñando una Casa Amigable con el Clima
ChapterDescription: The chapter begins with Unit Concept Checkpoint #2. Students share their findings about effective insulators, and then embark on a multi-day design challenge focused on designing, creating, and testing well-insulated homes. Students review the engineering design process, analyzing and redesigning their prototypes where necessary. Brochures document their design, construction, and testing processes. They share their completed prototypes and brochures in a presentation. Students conclude the unit by taking a final assessment, and reflecting on ethical decision-making within communities.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In the final chapter, we tackle the design challenge. Over several days, we'll apply the engineering design process to design, create, and test our own well-insulated homes. We document our processes by creating informative brochures showcasing our creativity, problem-solving skills, and the science behind our well-insulated homes. In the final stage, we present our completed prototypes and brochures to the class. It's crucial to consider how our designs and actions contribute to a sustainable and equitable future. So prepare for your final project - designing a climate-friendly home!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En el capítulo final, abordamos el desafío de diseño. Durante varios días, aplicamos el proceso de diseño de ingeniería para diseñar, crear y probar nuestras propias casas bien aisladas. Documentamos nuestros procesos creando folletos informativos que muestran nuestra creatividad, habilidades para resolver problemas y la ciencia detrás de nuestras casas bien aisladas. En la etapa final, presentamos nuestros prototipos y folletos completos a la clase. Es crucial considerar cómo nuestros diseños y acciones contribuyen a un futuro sostenible y equitativo. ¡Así que prepárense para su proyecto final: diseñar una casa amigable con el clima!

ChapterDescription: Students are introduced to the unit challenge: to redesign your home to conserve energy. They begin by taking a pre-assessment to gauge their prior knowledge about energy and energy transfer. The video Karbon Kombat explores different energy sources. Students then move on to the basics of wind power in preparation for a design project. They build their own wind turbines, then conduct tests and make improvements. These activities provide them with practical experience in applying engineering design principles, including iterative testing. Afterwards, students present their results and discuss them with peers.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this unit, you're going to study energy and how energy conservation at home can reduce pollution and save you and your family money. In this chapter, you'll be introduced to the unit challenge - to redesign your home to conserve energy. Then, you'll get started by learning about and designing your own wind turbine. Let’s get started!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En esta unidad, estudiarás la energía y cómo la conservación de energía en el hogar puede reducir la contaminación y ahorrar dinero a ti y a tu familia. En este capítulo, se te presentará el desafío de la unidad: rediseñar tu hogar para conservar energía. Luego, te pondrás en marcha aprendiendo sobre la energía eólica y diseñando tu propio aerogenerador. ¡Comencemos!

Spanish Chapter Name: Uso de Energía en el Hogar
ChapterDescription: The beginning of this chapter focuses on smart meter technology. Students gain hands-on experience using a power meter to calculate energy use, carbon emissions, and the costs associated with various electrical items. In addition to this, the Green Ninja Energy Tracker allows students to enter and analyze their home energy data. Data analysis plays a significant role in these lessons, as students compare their results to identify patterns and other interesting features. Students complete the Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 as a class, and then work in teams to apply engineering design principles and develop plans for decreasing energy consumption at home.
ChapterDescriptionStident: We're starting this chapter by diving into the fascinating world of smart meter technology. You'll step into the role of a scientist, using a real power meter to explore how much energy different devices use and how that impacts our planet and wallets. You'll also become an energy detective with the Green Ninja Energy Tracker at your side. Here's the fun part - you'll collect data about your own home's energy use and delve into that data to discover compelling patterns. Ready to make a real-world difference? Working with your team, you'll design a practical plan to save energy at home, putting into action all the things you've learned. So gear up to power up your knowledge and step into the role of an energy-saving hero.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Comenzamos este capítulo adentrándonos en el fascinante mundo de la tecnología de medición inteligente. Te convertirás en un científico, utilizando un medidor de energía real para explorar cuánta energía usan diferentes dispositivos y cómo esto afecta nuestro planeta y bolsillos. También te convertirás en un detective de energía con la ayuda del Rastreador de Energía Green Ninja. Aquí viene la parte divertida: recopilarás datos sobre el consumo de energía de tu propio hogar y analizarás esos datos para descubrir patrones interesantes. ¿Listo para hacer una diferencia en el mundo real? Trabajando con tu equipo, diseñarás un plan práctico para ahorrar energía en casa, poniendo en práctica todo lo que has aprendido. Así que prepárate para alimentar tu conocimiento y convertirte en un héroe que ahorra energía.

ChapterName: Thermal Mass and Passive Solar Homes
Spanish Chapter Name: Masa Térmica y Hogares Solares Pasivos
ChapterDescription: In these lessons, students are introduced to the concept of a passive solar home. The students explore the thermal properties of various materials and design experiments to investigate the factors that influence how materials heat up. They learn about scientific testing methods and apply them to design their own investigations. Through their experiments, the students determine how different factors affect the heating process of materials. Finally, they summarize their findings and assess their progress using the Green Ninja Energy Tracker.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Get ready for an exploration into the world of passive solar homes! You'll learn about thermal properties and discover the secrets behind materials that heat up quickly and slowly through some of your own investigations. You’ll review what you’ve learned and get the chance to check back in on progress with the Green Ninja Energy Tracker.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: ¡Prepárate para explorar el mundo de las casas solares pasivas! Aprenderás sobre las propiedades térmicas y descubrirás los secretos detrás de los materiales que se calientan rápidamente y los que lo hacen lentamente a través de algunas de tus propias investigaciones. Repasarás lo que has aprendido y tendrás la oportunidad de revisar el progreso con el Rastreador de Energía Green Ninja.

ChapterDescription: The lessons now move on to investigating solar orientation and how the angle of the Sun impacts the heating and cooling of passive solar buildings. Applying the concepts learned so far, the students create detailed designs for their passive solar homes. They then proceed to build models of their homes. Testing is important to show the effectiveness of their designs. Students showcase their homes during a gallery walk. The Unit Concept Checkpoint #2 helps to assess understanding of the unit's main concepts.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter takes us on a journey into the realm of solar orientation and its effects on heating and cooling in passive solar buildings. Using what you've learned, you'll get to put these ideas into action by creating designs for your own solar homes. But it doesn't stop there - you'll then transform your designs into 3D models. Testing your design's effectiveness will show you firsthand how the Sun's angle can impact heating and cooling. At the end, you'll display your home models in a gallery walk, sharing your ideas with your classmates. Get ready to transform from a student into an architect and a solar scientist.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo nos lleva en un viaje al reino de la orientación solar y sus efectos en la calefacción y refrigeración en edificios de energía solar pasiva. Usando lo que has aprendido, podrás poner en acción estas ideas creando diseños para tus propias casas solares. Pero no se detiene ahí, luego transformarás tus diseños en modelos 3D. La prueba de la efectividad de tu diseño te mostrará de primera mano cómo el ángulo del sol puede afectar la calefacción y refrigeración. Al final, exhibirás tus modelos de hogar en una galería para compartir tus ideas con tus compañeros de clase. Prepárate para transformarte de un estudiante a un arquitecto y científico solar.

ChapterDescription: Students now apply what they have learned about passive home design to suggest design improvements for different rooms and buildings in their school. Student teams use their communication skills to present their recommendations to the class and possibly to school officials.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, you'll learn how to use your newfound knowledge of passive home design to suggest improvements to various rooms and buildings in your own school. You’ll get the chance to form a team and explore the school looking for opportunities to use passive solar home design to conserve energy. "What if we replaced this wall with a large window, or what if we used window awnings to keep this building cool during summer?" Those are the types of design improvements you can suggest as you present your innovative recommendations to the class and maybe even the principal! Get ready to transform your school into a model of energy efficiency.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, aprenderás a usar tus nuevos conocimientos sobre el diseño de hogares pasivos para sugerir mejoras en varias habitaciones y edificios de tu propia escuela. Tendrás la oportunidad de formar un equipo y explorar la escuela en busca de oportunidades para usar el diseño de hogares solares pasivos para ahorrar energía. "¿Qué pasaría si reemplazamos esta pared con una ventana grande? ¿Qué pasaría si usamos toldos para mantener este edificio fresco durante el verano?" Esos son los tipos de mejoras de diseño que podrás sugerir al presentar tus recomendaciones innovadoras a la clase y tal vez incluso al director. Prepárate para transformar tu escuela en un modelo de eficiencia energética.

Spanish Chapter Name: Reduciendo el Uso de Energía en el Hogar
ChapterDescription: These lessons focus on analyzing and evaluating students' home energy conservation designs. Students compare their own designs with those of their peers. Student groups then develop presentations summarizing their results and findings, including recommendations for successfully reducing energy use in a community. They present their work to the class, and potentially film the presentations for sharing with parents. The final assessment demonstrates their understanding of the relationship between energy transfer, types of matter, and the resulting temperature changes. Afterwards, there is time for discussion and reflection.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In our final chapter, it's all about showcasing your home energy conservation plans. You'll have some time to delve into the data you've gathered and draw conclusions about what worked and what didn't. The key moment will be sharing your insights with the class, not just about your findings, but about the journey you took to get there. This chapter isn't just about wrapping up our unit, it's about celebrating your hard work and the valuable lessons you've learned about energy conservation. Prepare to step up and share your journey into the world of energy conservation at home.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En nuestro capítulo final, se trata de mostrar tus planes de conservación de energía en el hogar. Tendrás tiempo para analizar los datos que has recopilado y sacar conclusiones sobre lo que funcionó y lo que no. El momento clave será compartir tus ideas con la clase, no solo sobre tus hallazgos, sino sobre el viaje que tomaste para llegar allí. Este capítulo no se trata solo de cerrar nuestra unidad, se trata de celebrar tu arduo trabajo y las valiosas lecciones que has aprendido sobre la conservación de energía. Prepárate para compartir tu viaje al mundo de la conservación de energía en el hogar.

ChapterDescription: In this chapter, students are introduced to the unit challenge of creating a story about weather and climate extremes. They share weather stories and determine the difference between climate and weather. Satellite imagery and surface observation maps are studied to understand weather events. Students graph data to identify patterns and possible cause-and-effect relationships. They consider the impact of climate change, and start deciding which cities they will adopt for their project, learning how to analyze real-time data.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Welcome to the start of a unit on weather and climate. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to create a fascinating story that can warn and protect a friend or family member from future weather and climate extremes. Starting with sharing exciting weather stories, you'll learn the key difference between climate and weather. By investigating satellite images and surface observation maps, you'll understand how weather events come about. Then get ready to dig into data, graphing patterns, and probing cause-and-effect relationships. Climate change will be on the radar, too. By the end of this chapter, you'll be all set to adopt your cities that you’ll study during the year and focus on for the project.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Bienvenidos al comienzo de una unidad sobre el clima y el tiempo. Su misión, si deciden aceptarla, es crear una historia fascinante que pueda advertir y proteger a un amigo o familiar de futuros extremos climáticos y meteorológicos. Comenzando con compartir historias emocionantes sobre el clima, aprenderán la diferencia clave entre el clima y el tiempo. Al investigar imágenes de satélite y mapas de observación de la superficie, entenderán cómo se producen los eventos climáticos. Luego, prepárense para profundizar en los datos, graficar patrones y explorar relaciones causa-efecto. El cambio climático también estará en el radar. Al final de este capítulo, estarán listos para adoptar sus ciudades que estudiarán durante el año y enfocarse en ellas para el proyecto.

Spanish Chapter Name: Clima: Presión del Aire y Viento
ChapterDescription: In these lessons, students are introduced to the fundamentals of pressure and wind by studying the phenomenon of sea breeze circulation. They develop and refine a sea breeze circulation model, and then learn and practice the skills necessary to predict and forecast the weather accurately. These skills will be useful when analyzing weather data from their adopted cities.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we’ll dive into the fundamentals of pressure and wind, using sea breeze circulation as our model. We’ll also explore the art of weather prediction and forecasting. The skills you acquire here will come in handy when you analyze weather data from your adopted cities.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, nos adentraremos en los fundamentos de la presión y el viento, utilizando la circulación de la brisa marina como nuestro modelo. También exploraremos el arte de la predicción y el pronóstico del clima. Las habilidades que adquieran aquí serán útiles cuando analicen los datos meteorológicos de sus ciudades adoptadas.

ChapterDescription: Students now learn about the effects of Earth's rotation, including its influences on migrating birds and on weather and climate. They identify mid-latitude cyclones and search for evidence of cyclones in their weather data. Students then study the fundamentals of pressure and wind and observe a demonstration of cloud formation. They research their adopted cities, examining how weather affects the local community. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 helps students focus on key concepts. Finally, students analyze the accuracy of their weather forecasts for their adopted cities and improve their forecasting skills.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we'll look into the effects of Earth's rotation, learning how it influences migrating birds and, more importantly, our weather and climate. We'll identify mid-latitude cyclones and look for evidence of these in our weather data. Expect to see a cloud formation demonstration and learn more about wind and pressure. You'll also research how weather impacts the community in your adopted city, and polish your forecasting skills.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, examinaremos los efectos de la rotación de la Tierra, aprendiendo cómo influye en las aves migratorias y, más importante aún, en nuestro clima y tiempo. Identificaremos ciclones de latitudes medias y buscaremos evidencia de estos en nuestros datos meteorológicos. Esperen ver una demostración de formación de nubes y aprender más sobre el viento y la presión. También investigarán cómo el clima afecta a la comunidad en su ciudad adoptada y perfeccionarán sus habilidades de pronóstico.

ChapterDescription: Students differentiate between weather and climate, and then begin to study the climates of their adopted cities. Afterwards, students are introduced to the ways large-scale pressure systems can influence climate and use the 3-cell model of the global atmosphere to help explain the climate of their adopted cities.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we’ll revisit the difference between weather and climate and look in more detail into the climates of your adopted cities. You'll learn about large-scale pressure systems and their impact on climate, and use the 3-cell model of the global atmosphere to understand your cities' climate better. This information will help us create a science-oriented story about future weather and climate extremes in our adopted cities.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, revisaremos la diferencia entre clima y tiempo y examinaremos con más detalle los climas de sus ciudades adoptadas. Aprenderán sobre los sistemas de presión a gran escala y su impacto en el clima, y utilizarán el modelo de la atmósfera global de 3 células para comprender mejor el clima de sus ciudades. Esta información nos ayudará a crear una historia orientada a la ciencia sobre futuros extremos climáticos y meteorológicos en nuestras ciudades adoptadas.

ChapterDescription: Students now study the influence that a location's latitude and altitude have in determining the local climate. They discover how mountains can influence the weather and climate in different places, and they take a quiz on the factors affecting climate that they have learned so far.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Your exploration of climate continues in this short chapter as we study how latitude and altitude influence local climate. You'll learn how mountains can be climate game-changers and reinforce your knowledge on climate factors through a climate quiz.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Su exploración del clima continúa en este breve capítulo mientras estudiamos cómo la latitud y la altitud influyen en el clima local. Aprenderán cómo las montañas pueden cambiar el clima y reforzarán su conocimiento sobre los factores climáticos a través de un cuestionario sobre el clima.

ChapterDescription: In this chapter the focus shifts to oceans. Students participate in demonstrations to see how temperature and salinity result in different densities of water. They then apply these concepts to ocean water to understand how differences in temperature and salinity drive ocean currents. An activity that tracks plastic pollution in the ocean helps students to understand the role of Earth's rotation in ocean circulation.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we look at the oceans and we'll discover how temperature and salinity create varying water densities, and how this affects ocean currents. There's also an interesting activity where we track plastic pollution in the ocean to understand Earth's rotational effect on ocean circulation.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, miraremos los océanos y descubrirán cómo la temperatura y la salinidad crean diferentes densidades de agua, y cómo esto afecta las corrientes oceánicas. También hay una actividad interesante donde rastrearemos la contaminación plástica en el océano para comprender el efecto rotacional de la Tierra en la circulación oceánica.

ChapterDescription: Students participate in a matching game in which they link sets of data to different cities. They complete Unit Concept Checkpoint #2 and then explore scientific projections of climate change specific to their adopted cities. The cli-fi project involves creating a short story about one of their chosen cities, incorporating information about both its weather and its climate patterns. Finally, students present their cli-fi stories to their peers and turn in their final reports. The unit assessment evaluates student understanding of concepts from across the unit.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Now it’s time for the unit challenge. You'll be creating an engaging cli-fi (climate fiction) story, blending facts about your city's weather and climate patterns with a compelling story to help warn someone living in one of your chosen adopted cities about possible future weather and climate extremes. This is the time to put everything together that you’ve learned and create a masterpiece! Your story will be one part of a report that discusses and justifies the science behind your story. Telling a compelling story based on science and data may be an effective way of communicating important science with other people. Good luck!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Ahora es el momento del desafío de la unidad. Crearán una historia emocionante de cli-fi (ficción climática), mezclando hechos sobre los patrones climáticos y meteorológicos de su ciudad con una historia convincente para ayudar a advertir a alguien que vive en una de sus ciudades adoptadas sobre posibles futuros extremos climáticos y meteorológicos. ¡Es el momento de poner todo lo que han aprendido y crear una obra maestra! Su historia será una parte de un informe que discute y justifica la ciencia detrás de su historia. Contar una historia convincente basada en la ciencia y los datos puede ser una forma efectiva de comunicar información científica importante a otras personas. ¡Buena suerte!

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment which they later analyze. They investigate a variety of reproductive strategies and learn that organisms must reproduce for the survival of their species. Students study various reproductive methods, and then develop models to explain both sexual and asexual reproduction, as well as how genetic variation occurs within populations. Finally, students look at courtship behaviors to see both how animals select a mate and how these behaviors help animals to survive.
ChapterDescriptionStident: The unit challenge in this section calls for a method to protect a plant or animal species from climate change. To meet this challenge, we'll look into the intriguing domain of reproductive strategies across animal species. This chapter begins by studying different reproductive strategies, emphasizing that reproduction is crucial for transferring genetic information and ensuring species continuity. We'll create models to explain reproductive processes and understand the importance of genetic variation within populations. This exploration leads us to mechanisms that enable organisms to adapt and evolve. Let's get started!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: El desafío de la unidad en esta sección requiere un método para proteger una especie vegetal o animal del cambio climático. Para cumplir con este desafío, exploraremos el intrigante mundo de las estrategias reproductivas en diferentes especies animales. Este capítulo comienza estudiando diferentes estrategias reproductivas, enfatizando que la reproducción es crucial para transferir información genética y asegurar la continuidad de las especies. Crearemos modelos para explicar los procesos reproductivos y entender la importancia de la variación genética dentro de las poblaciones. Esta exploración nos lleva a mecanismos que permiten a los organismos adaptarse y evolucionar. ¡Empecemos!

ChapterDescription: Students now look at how animals care for their offspring; they will see a clear connection between the care of offspring and the survival of the species. “The (Animal) Dating Game” is a different way to share new knowledge. Students also consider how climate change may change animal behavior, thus affecting reproduction and the survival of a species. After this work, students present practical and specific actions that can offset the impact of climate change on animals. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 is completed at the end of this chapter.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter focuses on animal parenting and its crucial role in species survival. We start by examining the connection between parental care and species survival, exploring how animals nurture, protect, and guide their offspring, ensuring their species' future. A fun activity, "The (Animal) Dating Game," introduces us to the fascinating reproductive strategies organisms employ. However, we also investigate how changing environments disrupt crucial mating and breeding patterns, posing survival challenges. The chapter concludes by suggesting practical, specific actions to counter climate change impacts on animals, which will be helpful for the unit challenge - to protect a plant or animal from climate change.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo se centra en la crianza de animales y su papel crucial en la supervivencia de las especies. Comenzamos examinando la conexión entre el cuidado parental y la supervivencia de las especies, explorando cómo los animales nutren, protegen y guían a sus crías para garantizar el futuro de sus especies. Una actividad divertida, "El juego de citas (de animales)", nos presenta las fascinantes estrategias reproductivas que emplean los organismos. Sin embargo, también investigamos cómo los entornos cambiantes interrumpen patrones cruciales de apareamiento y reproducción, planteando desafíos para la supervivencia. El capítulo concluye sugiriendo acciones prácticas y específicas para contrarrestar los impactos del cambio climático en los animales, lo que será útil para el desafío de la unidad: proteger una planta o animal del cambio climático.

ChapterDescription: This chapter turns to plants—plant structures and functions, including the structures involved in plant reproduction. Students conduct experiments on seed dispersal and find evidence to support the claim that plant structures can increase the probability of successful reproduction. Students use scientific reasoning, supported by evidence and data, to prove this claim while considering plants from the same climate zone as one of their adopted cities. This chapter ends in a similar way to the previous chapter—students will suggest actions that can offset the impact of climate change on plants and their reproduction strategies.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Shifting our focus from animals to plants, we continue examining reproduction. We explore how plants ensure their survival and contribute to our natural world's beauty and balance. We conduct seed dispersal experiments, accumulating evidence that supports the claim that plant structures play a pivotal role in this process. We'll study plants from the climate zones of our adopted cities, understanding their specific environmental influences. Similar to the previous chapter, we'll think about climate change's impact and brainstorm actions to mitigate this impact and safeguard plant species' well-being.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Cambiando nuestro enfoque de los animales a las plantas, continuamos examinando la reproducción. Exploramos cómo las plantas aseguran su supervivencia y contribuyen a la belleza y el equilibrio de nuestro mundo natural. Realizamos experimentos de dispersión de semillas, acumulando evidencia que respalda la afirmación de que las estructuras de las plantas desempeñan un papel fundamental en este proceso. Estudiaremos plantas de las zonas climáticas de nuestras ciudades adoptadas, comprendiendo sus influencias ambientales específicas. Al igual que en el capítulo anterior, pensaremos en el impacto del cambio climático y generaremos ideas para mitigar este impacto y salvaguardar el bienestar de las especies vegetales.

Spanish Chapter Name: Crecimiento y Desarrollo de los Organismos
ChapterDescription: Students examine various genetic and environmental factors that affect the growth of organisms. They then research the growth patterns and environments of specific organisms. Afterwards, their findings are presented in a chart and shared for the class to see. This chapter includes Unit Concept Checkpoint #2.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter deepens our understanding of the genetic and environmental factors influencing organism growth. We study the growth patterns and environments of specific organisms and, in the spirit of scientific collaboration, work with partners to present our findings in a concise chart. This activity aims to improve our communication skills as we gather information from other charts and share our new knowledge in scientific writing, explaining what affects an organism’s growth.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo profundiza nuestra comprensión de los factores genéticos y ambientales que influyen en el crecimiento de los organismos. Estudiamos los patrones de crecimiento y los entornos de organismos específicos y, en el espíritu de la colaboración científica, trabajamos con socios para presentar nuestros hallazgos en un gráfico conciso. Esta actividad tiene como objetivo mejorar nuestras habilidades de comunicación a medida que recopilamos información de otros gráficos y compartimos nuestro nuevo conocimiento en escritura científica, explicando lo que afecta el crecimiento de un organismo.

Spanish Chapter Name: Proyecto de Protección de una Especie
ChapterDescription: The culminating experience of the unit is the Protect a Species Project. After a review of the project requirements, students study how climate change will affect their chosen species and brainstorm ideas for its protection. Students prepare posters and an oral presentation. During their preparations, students also have the opportunity to ask their peers questions and practice sharing key information. They are encouraged to share their presentations with someone in their adopted cities as well. A final assessment gauges understanding of how environmental and genetic factors affect species survival. To conclude, students learn about the reasons to protect the honey bee.
ChapterDescriptionStident: The final chapter focuses on the Protect a Species Project, where we apply our knowledge and passion to protect a species impacted by climate change. We’ll choose a species to study in one of our adopted cities from the weather and climate unit. In this way, we already know a lot about how environmental factors may be affecting species in this area. After studying how climate change impacts our chosen species, we’ll brainstorm ideas for species protection and conservation. We’ll then create posters and an oral presentation sharing our proposals, and then we'll share those proposals with someone in one of our adopted cities. The goal here is to help others understand that we can do something to protect threatened plants and animals.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: El capítulo final se centra en el Proyecto Proteger una Especie, donde aplicamos nuestro conocimiento y pasión para proteger una especie afectada por el cambio climático. Elegiremos una especie para estudiar en una de nuestras ciudades adoptadas de la unidad de clima y tiempo. De esta manera, ya sabemos mucho sobre cómo los factores ambientales pueden estar afectando a las especies en esta área. Después de estudiar cómo el cambio climático afecta a nuestra especie elegida, generaremos ideas para la protección y conservación de la especie. Luego crearemos pósters y una presentación oral compartiendo nuestras propuestas, y luego compartiremos esas propuestas con alguien en una de nuestras ciudades adoptadas. El objetivo aquí es ayudar a otros a entender que podemos hacer algo para proteger las plantas y animales amenazados.

ChapterDescription: The unit begins with a pre-assessment and an introduction to the unit challenge: To create a solution to reduce waste. Two Green Ninja videos serve as a stimulus to thinking. With the "Story of Trash" exercise, students model of what happens to waste and then share their models with the class. Afterwards, they study waste generation in the U.S., then collect and categorize trash at school. They then begin to formulate plans to reduce waste. California's AB-1826 legislation relating to waste is introduced, and students begin a five-day trash diary. Finally, they consider watersheds and how pollution enters Earth’s waterways.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Welcome to an interesting unit that will see you becoming a waste management expert. Your task is to create a solution to help reduce waste. You'll start the chapter with two Green Ninja videos, where you'll explore the "Story of Trash" and start building your own waste model. You'll gain hands-on experience in categorizing waste at school and start formulating plans for waste reduction. We'll look at some real-world legislation, like California's AB-1826, and start a five-day trash diary. Finally, we'll examine watersheds and explore how pollution can impact Earth's waterways.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Bienvenidos a una interesante unidad en la que se convertirán en expertos en gestión de residuos. Su tarea es crear una solución para ayudar a reducir los residuos. Comenzarán el capítulo con dos videos de Green Ninja, donde explorarán "La historia de la basura" y comenzarán a construir su propio modelo de residuos. Obtendrán experiencia práctica en categorizar residuos en la escuela y comenzarán a formular planes para reducir los residuos. Analizaremos legislación del mundo real, como la AB-1826 de California, y comenzaremos un diario de basura de cinco días. Finalmente, examinaremos cuencas hidrográficas y exploraremos cómo la contaminación puede afectar los cursos de agua de la Tierra.

ChapterDescription: Students explore evaporation and begin designing models of the water cycle, examining clouds and other phenomena such as fog and dew. Students investigate raindrops—their shape and formation, and follow what happens to water after it falls to Earth as precipitation. They then revise their water cycle concept map models. Afterwards, students extend their knowledge of the water cycle by creating comic strips about the journey of a water molecule through each of its stages. Finally, once it is completed, students share their comic strips with their peers.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we begin our investigation of pollution and waste in water by learning about the water cycle, with a particular focus on the science of evaporation. We'll design water cycle models and examine intriguing phenomena such as clouds, fog, and dew. You'll also study the journey of a raindrop - how it forms, and what happens after it falls to Earth. We'll finish off with some creativity, where you'll bring the journey of a water molecule to life in the form of a comic strip.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, comenzamos nuestra investigación de la contaminación y los residuos en el agua aprendiendo sobre el ciclo del agua, con un enfoque particular en la ciencia de la evaporación. Diseñaremos modelos del ciclo del agua y examinaremos fenómenos intrigantes como las nubes, la niebla y el rocío. También estudiarán el viaje de una gota de lluvia, cómo se forma y qué sucede después de que cae a la Tierra. Terminaremos con un poco de creatividad, donde darán vida al viaje de una molécula de agua en forma de una tira cómica.

ChapterDescription: Students are introduced to the project they will use to address the unit challenge. They continue their focus on pollution and waste as they move from studying the water cycle to studying the life in pond water. They discover that some living things are comprised of only a single cell. They learn from cell theory that living things are made up of cells. Then, they connect their understanding of the water cycle, cells, and how waste moves around. Students perform an investigation to provide evidence that living things are made of cells, and submit reports for assessment. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 is completed in this chapter.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Now, it's time to turn our focus towards our unit challenge - finding ways to reduce pollution and waste. We'll transition from studying the water cycle to examining pond life and discover that some organisms are single-celled. Using our understanding of cell theory, we'll connect the dots between the water cycle, cells, and waste. You'll also have the chance to provide evidence that all living things are made of cells.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Ahora es el momento de centrarnos en nuestro desafío de la unidad: encontrar formas de reducir la contaminación y los residuos. Pasaremos de estudiar el ciclo del agua a examinar la vida en los estanques y descubriremos que algunos organismos son unicelulares. Utilizando nuestra comprensión de la teoría celular, conectaremos los puntos entre el ciclo del agua, las células y los residuos. También tendrán la oportunidad de proporcionar evidencia de que todos los seres vivos están hechos de células.

ChapterDescription: In this series of lessons, students continue their exploration of cell structure as they look at the cell membrane's role in regulating the passage of water into cells. Students watch a demonstration of a selectively permeable membrane, then develop and critique models to illustrate how the cell membrane controls the entry and exit of substances. In teams, they analyze their trash diaries and evaluate the effectiveness of their action plans. Lastly, students provide an explanation about the effects of pollution in light of their new knowledge about cells.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Our exploration of cells continues in this chapter, as we focus on the cell membrane and its role in controlling the passage of substances. You'll get to observe a demonstration of a selectively permeable membrane and develop your own models. Additionally, you'll assess your trash diaries and evaluate the effectiveness of your waste reduction plans. Ultimately, you'll explore how pollution can affect cells and thereby all living things. This understanding will help motivate us about the importance of our unit project - to design a method to reduce pollution and waste.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Nuestra exploración de las células continúa en este capítulo, mientras nos enfocamos en la membrana celular y su papel en el control del paso de sustancias. Verán una demostración de una membrana selectivamente permeable y desarrollarán sus propios modelos. Además, evaluarán sus diarios de basura y evaluarán la efectividad de sus planes de reducción de residuos. En última instancia, explorarán cómo la contaminación puede afectar a las células y, por lo tanto, a todos los seres vivos. Esta comprensión nos ayudará a motivarnos sobre la importancia de nuestro proyecto de unidad: diseñar un método para reducir la contaminación y los residuos.

ChapterDescription: Students begin by studying the organization of complex organisms, learning about the hierarchical relationship between cells and complete organisms. A special skills lesson helps students acquire strategies for conducting efficient online research, essential not only in this unit but also for future activities. In groups, students research specific body systems and create posters to educate their peers. A rubric guides students and sets expectations. In an interactive poster session, students present their completed posters, then explore and learn from the research conducted by their peers.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter takes you on a journey through the organization of complex organisms, from cells to complete organisms. To aid your exploration, you'll learn effective strategies for conducting online research. In your groups, you'll delve into specific body systems, create informative posters, and share your findings in an interactive poster session. Now we can more clearly see how even pollution at the cellular level can impact an entire organism.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo los llevará en un viaje a través de la organización de organismos complejos, desde células hasta organismos completos. Para ayudar en su exploración, aprenderán estrategias efectivas para realizar investigaciones en línea. En sus grupos, profundizarán en sistemas corporales específicos, crearán carteles informativos y compartirán sus hallazgos en una sesión interactiva de carteles. Ahora podemos ver más claramente cómo incluso la contaminación a nivel celular puede impactar a todo un organismo.

ChapterDescription: The chapter begins with an engaging activity to develop understanding of the interactions of body systems—students take on the roles of healthcare workers and assess “patients”, and then explore how transplants help in treating of serious health problems. Students review the qualities of a Green Ninja, making connections between environmental issues and science concepts. A range of relevant career pathways is considered. Students realize that ancient scientists extended their knowledge by building upon the work of others. Unit Concept Checkpoint #2 concludes this chapter.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we'll engage in an activity where you'll become healthcare workers assessing 'patients' who are struggling with challenges related to environmental exposure. This activity will help us better understand the interactions of body systems. Connections will be drawn between environmental issues and science concepts, and we'll consider relevant career paths.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, participarán en una actividad en la que se convertirán en trabajadores de la salud evaluando a "pacientes" que enfrentan desafíos relacionados con la exposición ambiental. Esta actividad nos ayudará a comprender mejor las interacciones de los sistemas corporales. Se establecerán conexiones entre los problemas ambientales y los conceptos científicos, y se considerarán carreras relevantes.

Spanish Chapter Name: Proyecto de Reducción de la Contaminación
ChapterDescription: In the culminating activity, student teams gather the data they have collected during the unit to design four-square posters highlighting the results of their action plans. Analysis and reflection are important components of this project. The final assessment demonstrates student understanding of cell structure and function, the body as a system, and the cycling of water through Earth’s systems. To conclude, students reflect on their achievements throughout the unit.
ChapterDescriptionStident: It's time to bring it all together in the final chapter. In this culminating activity, you'll gather your data to design posters sharing the proposals and results of your waste and pollution reduction action plans. This chapter involves reflecting on your project and understanding the interconnectedness of cell structure, body systems, and the water cycle. We also should understand that if some of our proposals were adopted by others, we really could see our community become cleaner and healthier.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Es hora de unir todo en el capítulo final. En esta actividad culminante, reunirán sus datos para diseñar carteles que compartan las propuestas y resultados de sus planes de acción para la reducción de residuos y contaminación. Este capítulo implica reflexionar sobre su proyecto y comprender la interconexión de la estructura celular, los sistemas corporales y el ciclo del agua. También debemos comprender que si algunos de nuestros planes fueran adoptados por otros, podríamos ver que nuestra comunidad se vuelva más limpia y saludable.

ChapterDescription: To begin this unit, students are introduced to the unit challenge: Tell a story that will change the world. The steps needed to achieve their goal are outlined. Students take a pre-assessment testing understanding of storytelling and sensory perception. A discussion about prior unit challenges and solutions to climate change orients the students toward possible stories. Students explore human sensory responses to visuals and sounds in film, and then gather information about how messages are received in the brain from sensory receptors which respond to stimuli.
ChapterDescriptionStident: To start off this unit, we have a big challenge for you: to tell a story that will change the world. We're going to learn about storytelling and filmmaking, and also about how our senses influence our thoughts and feelings. We’ll discuss the challenges we face with climate change and some of the creative solutions people are coming up with. Then you'll step into the shoes of a changemaker to create your own stories about solutions to an environmental challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Para comenzar esta unidad, tenemos un gran desafío para ti: contar una historia que cambie el mundo. Aprenderemos sobre narración de historias y producción cinematográfica, y también sobre cómo nuestros sentidos influyen en nuestros pensamientos y sentimientos. Discutiremos los desafíos que enfrentamos con el cambio climático y algunas soluciones creativas que las personas están ideando. Luego, te pondrás en los zapatos de un agente de cambio para crear tus propias historias sobre soluciones a un desafío ambiental.

ChapterDescription: Students design a research project analyzing audience response to media. They brainstorm themes, develop two versions of a message, and seek feedback from peers. They create a survey tool to collect data, and then present their media pieces to different people. The results are collated and analyzed. Students learn about source verification and evaluate scientific research on the impacts that media/images have on human behavior. Finally, students revisit their model of sensory response and reflect on how their findings can inform their storytelling.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, you’ll take on the role of a researcher to study how different people react to various messages. We're all unique individuals with our own quirks and preferences, including the way we receive and respond to messages. You're going to conduct a small research project, creating your own survey tool and collecting data to explore how people respond to different messages. This study will help us better understand how to create impactful messages for different audiences.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, asumirás el papel de investigador para estudiar cómo diferentes personas reaccionan a varios mensajes. Todos somos individuos únicos con nuestras propias peculiaridades y preferencias, incluida la forma en que recibimos y respondemos a los mensajes. Realizarás un pequeño proyecto de investigación, creando tu propia herramienta de encuesta y recopilando datos para explorar cómo las personas responden a diferentes mensajes. Este estudio nos ayudará a comprender mejor cómo crear mensajes impactantes para diferentes audiencias.

ChapterDescription: The Story Spine is explained as a framework for storytelling. Then, students view a Green Ninja episode and break it down using the Story Spine. They also apply the Story Spine to The Three Little Pigs, and retell this story with a scientific twist. While working to finalize two story pitches, students also watch a student-made film for inspiration. Afterwards, they select one of their two story pitches to polish. They learn about basic film techniques, and then practice shooting mini video interviews. Finally, students develop storyboards for their films.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter is focused on the exciting world of storytelling and media analysis. We will begin by introducing the Story Spine, a framework to help you create engaging narratives. We’ll have fun using the Story Spine to analyze stories, and you will surprise your classmates with your new version of The Three Little Pigs! The main goal of this unit is to give you time to develop your own story. You’ll have the chance to brainstorm different ideas and refine your story with other students. You’ll learn the art of filmmaking and have the opportunity to practice and refine your skills. Anyone can come up with a story, but creating a great one requires persistence and hard work. Let’s get going!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo se enfoca en el emocionante mundo de la narración de historias y el análisis de medios. Comenzaremos presentando la Espina de la Historia, un marco para ayudarte a crear narrativas atractivas. Nos divertiremos usando la Espina de la Historia para analizar historias, ¡y sorprenderás a tus compañeros de clase con tu nueva versión de Los Tres Cerditos! El objetivo principal de esta unidad es darte tiempo para desarrollar tu propia historia. Tendrás la oportunidad de generar diferentes ideas y perfeccionar tu historia con otros estudiantes. Aprenderás el arte de la producción cinematográfica y tendrás la oportunidad de practicar y perfeccionar tus habilidades. Cualquiera puede idear una historia, pero crear una gran historia requiere persistencia y trabajo duro. ¡Empecemos!

ChapterDescription: Students are now ready to start producing and shooting their films, drawing on the knowledge they have gained throughout the unit. They share their videos with peers, family, and friends for feedback. Digital portfolios are part of the assessment and are submitted along with the films. The unit concludes with a Green Ninja Film Festival and a presentation of awards.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Now for the final chapter: it's time to bring your filmmaking skills to life! You'll have lots to remember as you think about the Story Spine, your storyboard, and the different video techniques you've been practicing. Props, costumes, dialogue, video equipment - it'll be all the fun of a real film set. And finally, you will have the opportunity to show your film to other students and maybe even the world via the Green Ninja Film Festival. Who knows - you may create a film that really does change the world!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Ahora, para el último capítulo: ¡es hora de dar vida a tus habilidades de producción cinematográfica! Tendrás mucho en qué pensar mientras consideras la Espina de la Historia, tu guión gráfico y las diferentes técnicas de video que has estado practicando. Accesorios, vestuario, diálogo, equipo de video: será toda la diversión de un verdadero set de filmación. Y finalmente, tendrás la oportunidad de mostrar tu película a otros estudiantes y tal vez incluso al mundo a través del Festival de Cine Green Ninja. Quién sabe, ¡puedes crear una película que realmente cambie el mundo!

ChapterDescription: Students gain an understanding of the resources involved in manufacturing smartphones. The unit challenge, to design a more sustainable smartphone, is introduced. Students classify the main parts of a smartphone, and identify the materials used and recognize their  scarcity. Rare earth elements (REEs) ae introduced. Resources are assigned to students who then conduct research into their physical characteristics, applications, and locations, marking them on a world map. Students present their findings and conclude by writing summaries highlighting their understanding of the worldwide distribution of material resources.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Welcome to the start of a unit where you'll be tasked with an important challenge: designing a more sustainable smartphone. This initial chapter will have you classifying the main parts of a smartphone, identifying the materials used in their manufacture, and understanding the scarcity of these resources. We'll delve into Rare Earth Elements, and you'll research their physical properties, applications, and locations worldwide. By presenting your findings and writing summaries, you'll demonstrate your understanding of the global distribution of material resources. This knowledge will be instrumental as you move forward with the unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Bienvenidos al comienzo de una unidad en la que se les encargará un desafío importante: diseñar un teléfono inteligente más sostenible. Este capítulo inicial los llevará a clasificar las principales partes de un teléfono inteligente, identificar los materiales utilizados en su fabricación y comprender la escasez de estos recursos. Profundizaremos en los Elementos de Tierras Raras, y buscarán información sobre sus propiedades físicas, aplicaciones y ubicaciones en todo el mundo. Al presentar sus hallazgos y escribir resúmenes, demostrarán su comprensión de la distribución global de los recursos materiales. Este conocimiento será fundamental a medida que avancen con el desafío de la unidad.

ChapterDescription: This chapter begins with an explanation about using Claims-Evidence-Reasoning (CER) as a tool for constructing scientific explanations. Students begin exploring evidence to support Wegener’s hypothesis about continental drift by performing a skit and building a Pangaea puzzle. They analyze the creation of new seafloor by making models and using non-contact rangefinders. Using these experiences, they write CER statements supporting Wegener’s theory. Students then return to the skit to write a prologue using evidence from more recent findings. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 is included in this chapter.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we're reviewing the tool of Claims-Evidence-Reasoning (CER) for constructing scientific explanations. You'll investigate continental drift, Wegener's hypothesis, by performing a skit and building a Pangaea puzzle. Exploring the creation of new seafloor through model-making and non-contact rangefinders, you'll write CER statements supporting Wegener's theory. By the end of the chapter, you'll have a more comprehensive understanding of the Earth's geology, which will be invaluable in creating a more sustainable smartphone.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, revisaremos la herramienta de Reclamaciones-Evidencias-Razonamientos (CER) para construir explicaciones científicas. Investigarán la deriva continental, la hipótesis de Wegener, realizando una obra de teatro y armando un rompecabezas de Pangea. Explorarán la creación de nuevo fondo marino mediante la fabricación de modelos y telémetros sin contacto, y escribirán declaraciones CER que respalden la teoría de Wegener. Al final del capítulo, tendrán una comprensión más completa de la geología de la Tierra, que será invaluable en la creación de un teléfono inteligente más sostenible.

ChapterDescription: Students begin exploring the rock cycle by observing a rock floating on water, discovering it is made of sugar. They create a diagram showing both an Earth-made rock and the sugar rock, and reflect on the igneous rock process. In a similar investigation, another diagram is created showing the formation of sedimentary rocks. The microscope reveals a different rock, this time a metamorphic rock. A kinesthetic rock cycle game allows students to experience the transformation of rocks. Students write Rock Cycle Stories, and construct flowcharts of journeys that rocks undertake throughout the rock cycle. Student understanding can be evaluated in Unit Concept Checkpoint #2.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we’ll prepare for a journey through the rock cycle. Starting with a sugar rock that floats on water, you'll diagram the formation process of this sugar rock and an Earth-made rock. This activity helps illuminate the process of igneous rock formation. From sedimentary to metamorphic rocks, each type will be studied, providing a hands-on understanding of the rock cycle. Finishing the chapter with a kinesthetic rock cycle game, Rock Cycle Stories, and flowcharts of rock journeys will further solidify your understanding of the materials that make up our smartphones.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, nos prepararemos para un viaje a través del ciclo de las rocas. Comenzando con una roca de azúcar que flota sobre el agua, diagramarán el proceso de formación de esta roca de azúcar y una roca hecha en la Tierra. Esta actividad ayuda a iluminar el proceso de formación de rocas ígneas. Desde rocas sedimentarias hasta rocas metamórficas, se estudiará cada tipo, proporcionando una comprensión práctica del ciclo de las rocas. Terminando el capítulo con un juego cinestésico de ciclo de las rocas, Historias del ciclo de las rocas, y diagramas de flujo de los viajes de las rocas, se solidificará aún más su comprensión de los materiales que componen nuestros teléfonos inteligentes.

ChapterDescription: Having analyzed the life cycle of smartphones, it is time now to design a more sustainable smartphone. Students will create pamphlets educating people on the environmental impact of smartphones, and proposing sustainable solutions. After brainstorming and receiving peer feedback, students work on mock-ups and prepare their final pamphlets. During a gallery walk, students vote for the best pamphlets in different categories. Finally, students reflect on the connections between science, technology, and the environment in the context of smartphones. A post-assessment is followed by personal reflections on the unit.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this final chapter, it's time to apply your accumulated knowledge towards the unit challenge: designing a more sustainable smartphone. This chapter will have you creating educational pamphlets on the environmental impact of smartphones and proposing sustainable alternatives. After a period of brainstorming and peer feedback, you'll work on your mock-ups and prepare your final pamphlets. During a gallery walk, everyone will vote for their favorite pamphlets. Finally, reflecting on the connections between science, technology, and the environment in the context of smartphones will give you insights into your unit challenge outcome and possible future ideas on how to make many different products more sustainable.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo final, es hora de aplicar su conocimiento acumulado hacia el desafío de la unidad: diseñar un teléfono inteligente más sostenible. Este capítulo los llevará a crear folletos educativos sobre el impacto ambiental de los teléfonos inteligentes y proponer alternativas sostenibles. Después de un período de lluvia de ideas y retroalimentación de sus compañeros, trabajarán en sus prototipos y prepararán sus folletos finales. Durante una caminata por la galería, todos votarán por sus folletos favoritos. Finalmente, reflexionar sobre las conexiones entre la ciencia, la tecnología y el medio ambiente en el contexto de los teléfonos inteligentes les dará ideas sobre el resultado del desafío de la unidad y posibles ideas futuras sobre cómo hacer que muchos productos sean más sostenibles.

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment and then watch a Green Ninja video to introduce the unit challenge: To reduce your family’s dependence on petroleum for transportation. Students begin collecting data in transportation journals for use in upcoming lessons. They view a narration describing how petroleum forms, then create illustrations and write summaries of the process. An interesting activity using asterisks helps students grasp the enormity of a hundred million years and the time required for the formation of petroleum. Students consider whether petroleum is a renewable or nonrenewable resource.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Welcome to a journey into the world of energy and transportation! Get ready to explore and learn about reducing our dependence on petroleum. What's the challenge for this unit? To reduce your family's dependence on petroleum for transportation! The chapter starts with you becoming a transportation detective as you observe and record how your family uses different means of transport and explore various options. We'll also begin to explore the process of petroleum formation. Just how long does it take for petroleum to form?
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: ¡Bienvenido a un viaje al mundo de la energía y el transporte! Prepárate para explorar y aprender sobre cómo reducir nuestra dependencia del petróleo. ¿Cuál es el desafío de esta unidad? ¡Reducir la dependencia de tu familia del petróleo para el transporte! El capítulo comienza convirtiéndote en un detective del transporte mientras observas y registras cómo tu familia utiliza diferentes medios de transporte y exploras varias opciones. También comenzaremos a explorar el proceso de formación del petróleo. ¿Cuánto tiempo tarda el petróleo en formarse?

ChapterDescription: Students explore the formation and nature of petroleum as a resource and engage in a scavenger hunt to locate global petroleum reserves. They identify the top ten reserves and deliver mock interviews providing evidence-based explanations for the uneven distribution. The focus then shifts to human use of petroleum, with a timeline showing the significant increase in human petroleum consumption and its impact on global distribution. Students create data tables to organize their family's mileage records, and then brainstorm strategies and develop action plans to reduce gasoline-dependent transportation. This chapter includes Unit Concept Checkpoint #1.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we'll delve deeper into the formation and nature of petroleum as a valuable resource. You'll use your investigative skills on a scavenger hunt to locate global petroleum reserves, and then use your communication skills to explain why these reserves are unevenly distributed. Next, we'll shift our focus to human use of petroleum. Many of us will be surprised to see a timeline showing how petroleum consumption has changed over time. We'll organize our information with data tables and use this information to brainstorm strategies to reduce our use of petroleum in the future.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, profundizaremos (sin doble sentido) en la formación y naturaleza del petróleo como un recurso valioso. Utilizarás tus habilidades de investigación en una búsqueda del tesoro para localizar las reservas globales de petróleo y luego utilizarás tus habilidades de comunicación para explicar por qué estas reservas están distribuidas de manera desigual. Luego, cambiaremos nuestro enfoque al uso humano del petróleo. Muchos de nosotros nos sorprenderemos al ver una línea de tiempo que muestra cómo ha cambiado el consumo de petróleo con el tiempo. Organizaremos nuestra información con tablas de datos y utilizaremos esta información para idear estrategias para reducir nuestro uso de petróleo en el futuro.

ChapterDescription: Students investigate why gasoline is such a great energy source. They study the structure of hydrocarbons by making two- and three-dimensional models of simple hydrocarbon chains. Afterwards, they review the change of state between liquid and gas, and relate it to a distillation unit. Students use this understanding to design experiments to separate a mixture of two liquids. Then they perform the fractional distillation of water and rubbing alcohol using the procedure they designed. Finally, they determine methods to verify that the separation was successful, complete graphic organizers, and write a story explaining fractional distillation.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Science comes to life in this chapter with models, experiments, and creative storytelling. Get ready to travel into the world of gasoline and its incredible energy properties. We'll uncover the secrets of hydrocarbons, the magical molecules that make up gasoline. Then, you'll design your own experiments to figure out how to separate mixtures like they do in the petroleum industry. You'll share what you've learned by creating a story about the entire distillation process.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: La ciencia cobra vida en este capítulo con modelos, experimentos y narración creativa. Prepárate para viajar al mundo de la gasolina y sus increíbles propiedades energéticas. Descubriremos los secretos de los hidrocarburos, las moléculas mágicas que conforman la gasolina. Luego, diseñarás tus propios experimentos para descubrir cómo separar mezclas como lo hacen en la industria del petróleo. Compartirás lo que has aprendido creando una historia sobre todo el proceso de destilación.

ChapterDescription: Students begin by examining how plastics are refined, and by developing models of polymers. They create cross-linked polymers, recording observations of the process. The class then makes a chart showing the different types of plastic products used at home. They watch a video highlighting different paths of the plastic life cycle and showing the importance of recycling and reducing plastic usage. Students research and compare bioplastics and petroleum-based plastics using decision matrices. Finally, they apply engineering design principles to imagine a container for transporting vital organs.
ChapterDescriptionStident: We move on to an intriguing chapter about the world of plastics and their refinement. To kick things off, we'll create models of polymers, then experiment with real polymers. Watch them develop before your eyes! You'll investigate the variety of properties of different plastics, recognizing their incredible versatility in our everyday lives. We'll also explore the bigger picture: the plastic life cycle, and the importance of recycling and reducing our plastic usage.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Pasamos a un capítulo intrigante sobre el mundo de los plásticos y su refinamiento. Para comenzar, crearemos modelos de polímeros y luego experimentaremos con polímeros reales. ¡Los verás desarrollarse ante tus ojos! Investigarás la variedad de propiedades de diferentes plásticos, reconociendo su increíble versatilidad en nuestra vida cotidiana. También exploraremos la imagen más amplia: el ciclo de vida del plástico y la importancia del reciclaje y la reducción de nuestro uso de plástico.

ChapterDescription: In this chapter, students analyze and interpret graphs and explain the relationship between datasets. They then construct explanations for transportation’s carbon footprint using the CER format. A combustion animation tool helps students investigate why transportation produces GHGs. Finally, students construct an explanation as to why different hydrocarbons release different amounts of carbon dioxide during combustion.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this short chapter, you'll examine graphs on petroleum production, carbon dioxide levels, and global temperatures. Your task is to find their connections and determine transportation's role in this mix using the CER format. Ready to become a data detective? Let's go!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este breve capítulo, examinarás gráficos sobre la producción de petróleo, los niveles de dióxido de carbono y las temperaturas globales. Tu tarea es encontrar sus conexiones y determinar el papel del transporte en esta mezcla utilizando el formato CER. ¿Listo para convertirte en un detective de datos? ¡Vamos!

ChapterDescription: Students now learn about air quality measurements, pollutants, and the Air Quality Index (AQI). Students design and set up their own air quality monitors. They investigate the effect of wildfires on air quality while analyzing the components of wildfire smoke. Based on their findings, students create wildfire alert bulletins. An analysis of California EEI maps shows factors affecting air quality.  Students share findings from their air quality monitors, revising their designs if necessary. Unit Concept Checkpoint #2 is found in this chapter.
