ChapterDescriptionStident: It's time to become guardians of clean air. But how do we measure air quality? That's where the Air Quality Index (AQI) comes in. You'll become familiar with this valuable tool, learning how to interpret its readings to support our health and well-being. You'll have the amazing opportunity to design and set up your very own air quality monitors, gathering real-time data to see what's really happening around you. Creativity and communication combine as you use real-world data to inform and protect others from potential air quality hazards.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Es hora de convertirnos en guardianes del aire limpio. Pero, ¿cómo medimos la calidad del aire? Ahí es donde entra en juego el Índice de Calidad del Aire (ICA). Te familiarizarás con esta valiosa herramienta, aprendiendo a interpretar sus lecturas para apoyar nuestra salud y bienestar. Tendrás la increíble oportunidad de diseñar y configurar tus propios monitores de calidad del aire, recopilando datos en tiempo real para ver lo que realmente está sucediendo a tu alrededor. La creatividad y la comunicación se combinan mientras utilizas datos del mundo real para informar y proteger a otros de posibles peligros de calidad del aire.

ChapterDescription: Students finalize work on their air quality monitor design, and begin the culminating activity. They produce scripts for plays or commercials in the form of Public Service Announcements to educate people about the importance of reducing petroleum-based transportation. After filming the PSAs, students gather feedback from family and friends. Students show their PSAs to the class, vote for their favorites, and receive certificates. They then complete a unit assessment. Three case studies highlight changemakers who are using less. Finally, an interactive presentation gives strategies to reduce, rather than reuse or recycle.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In the final chapter of the unit, your inner filmmaker can come alive as you create a Public Service Announcement (PSA) emphasizing the importance of reducing petroleum-based transportation. You'll write scripts that capture the essence of the message and highlight the need for sustainable alternatives. Grab your cameras and film your PSAs, showcasing your acting skills, visual storytelling techniques, and persuasive abilities. Insights from family and friends, your very own focus group, will help you refine and improve your ideas. Finally, you’ll share your PSAs and engage in a friendly competition. It's an opportunity to appreciate the incredible work of your peers and learn from their approaches.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En el capítulo final de la unidad, tu cineasta interior puede cobrar vida mientras creas un Anuncio de Servicio Público (PSA) que enfatice la importancia de reducir el transporte basado en el petróleo. Escribirás guiones que capturen la esencia del mensaje y destaquen la necesidad de alternativas sostenibles. Toma tus cámaras y filma tus PSAs, mostrando tus habilidades de actuación, técnicas de narración visual y habilidades persuasivas. Los comentarios de familiares y amigos, tu propio grupo de enfoque, te ayudarán a refinar y mejorar tus ideas. Finalmente, compartirás tus PSAs y participarás en una competencia amistosa. Es una oportunidad para apreciar el increíble trabajo de tus compañeros y aprender de sus enfoques.

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment, followed by a Green Ninja video, and are then introduced to the unit challenge: How can we reduce the carbon footprint of the food we eat? Students investigate why we eat, where our food comes from, and make mind maps to show where plants get the materials and energy they need. They evaluate an old scientific investigation by van Helmont. Using manipulatives, they build models of the photosynthesis reaction. Afterwards, students investigate photosynthesis further by measuring a plant's carbon dioxide levels.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this unit, our challenge is to reduce the carbon footprint of the food we eat. To help meet this challenge, we'll dive into the intriguing world of food, its sources, and its environmental impact. Our journey starts with a Green Ninja video that introduces the challenge. We'll then look into why we eat and where our food comes from, discovering the detailed processes that plants employ for growth. To better grasp these concepts, we'll create mind maps, helping us understand the food chain and the crucial biological process of photosynthesis. This knowledge will be instrumental when we're later tasked with making more environmentally friendly food choices for the unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En esta unidad, nuestro desafío es reducir la huella de carbono de los alimentos que comemos. Para ayudar a cumplir con este desafío, nos sumergiremos en el intrigante mundo de los alimentos, sus fuentes y su impacto ambiental. Nuestro viaje comienza con un video de Green Ninja que presenta el desafío. Luego exploraremos por qué comemos y de dónde provienen nuestros alimentos, descubriendo los procesos detallados que las plantas utilizan para crecer. Para comprender mejor estos conceptos, crearemos mapas mentales que nos ayudarán a entender la cadena alimentaria y el crucial proceso biológico de la fotosíntesis. Este conocimiento será fundamental cuando más adelante se nos encargue tomar decisiones alimentarias más respetuosas con el medio ambiente para el desafío de la unidad.

ChapterDescription: Students conduct investigations to determine if a chemical reaction has occurred. They explore the absorption or release of energy, resulting in temperature changes. Using the information they have gathered, they begin an engineering design challenge constructing a device that either releases or absorbs thermal energy through chemical reactions. Students suggest practical applications, and, after defining the design criteria, they build their device. They evaluate designs and identify the characteristics that will optimize their design solutions. Final iterations of their designs are completed and written reports are turned in. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 provides a quick check on understanding.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter turns us into curious scientists and innovative engineers, as we learn about chemical reactions and their energy impacts. These are critical insights as we think about the energy used to produce our food for the unit challenge. Our experiments will provide the evidence needed to understand chemical reactions. We'll then undertake an engineering design challenge to construct a thermal energy-related device. We'll brainstorm, select materials, and refine our designs. Finally, we'll write up our experiences and results, providing insights that may inspire future food-related innovations.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo nos convierte en científicos curiosos e ingenieros innovadores, ya que aprendemos sobre las reacciones químicas y su impacto energético. Estos son conocimientos críticos mientras pensamos en la energía utilizada para producir nuestros alimentos para el desafío de la unidad. Nuestros experimentos proporcionarán la evidencia necesaria para comprender las reacciones químicas. Luego, realizaremos un desafío de diseño de ingeniería para construir un dispositivo relacionado con la energía térmica. Realizaremos una lluvia de ideas, seleccionaremos materiales y perfeccionaremos nuestros diseños. Finalmente, escribiremos nuestras experiencias y resultados, brindando ideas que pueden inspirar futuras innovaciones relacionadas con los alimentos.

ChapterName: Chemical Reactions and Energy for Life
ChapterDescription: To summarize photosynthesis, students build photosynthesis cubes. They begin a food journal in preparation for the culminating activity, use flowcharts as a tool for visualizing the path of food through the body, and then design models of cellular respiration. To investigate the production of carbon dioxide during cellular respiration, students measure the amount of carbon dioxide produced by yeast. Students compare and contrast photosynthesis and cellular respiration using a Venn diagram. Finally, they construct storyboards to depict the cellular respiration process.
ChapterDescriptionStident: By the end of this chapter, we'll gain a deeper understanding of photosynthesis and cellular respiration, crucial processes in the food we consume. Starting with cubes that summarize our knowledge about photosynthesis, we'll then start a food journal, tracing how our bodies break down and absorb nutrients. We'll also delve into cellular respiration, creating models that demonstrate how cells utilize oxygen and produce carbon dioxide. Through hands-on experiences, we'll get a closer look at how living organisms process food to release energy. This will provide a foundation for understanding the energy flow in our food choices for the unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Al final de este capítulo, ganaremos una comprensión más profunda de la fotosíntesis y la respiración celular, procesos cruciales en los alimentos que consumimos. Comenzando con cubos que resumen nuestro conocimiento sobre la fotosíntesis, comenzaremos un diario de alimentos, rastreando cómo nuestros cuerpos descomponen y absorben nutrientes. También profundizaremos en la respiración celular, creando modelos que demuestren cómo las células utilizan el oxígeno y producen dióxido de carbono. A través de experiencias prácticas, tendremos una visión más cercana de cómo los organismos vivos procesan los alimentos para liberar energía. Esto proporcionará una base para comprender el flujo de energía en nuestras elecciones alimentarias para el desafío de la unidad.

ChapterDescription: Students reflect on previous lessons, then visit the MyPlate website, which helps them categorize food groups into a table. Afterwards, they complete the Analyzing Food Choices Project. Students explore the amount of energy required to produce food and conduct research on different stages of the food life cycle to compare GHG emissions. They produce carbon foodprint pamphlets and share them through a jigsaw activity. Lastly, students discover historical as well as current sustainable food production practices in Hawaii. This chapter contains Unit Concept Checkpoint #2.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we reflect on our learning so far, discussing the key takeaways. Next, we study different food groups and categorize foods into a table. This gives us a clearer understanding of what makes a balanced meal, which will be useful for the unit challenge. We'll then consider the environmental impact of our food, especially greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, which can significantly affect our planet. To communicate our findings, we'll create carbon 'foodprint' pamphlets, an educational and engaging way to share information about the environmental impact of our food choices.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, reflexionaremos sobre nuestro aprendizaje hasta ahora, discutiendo las principales conclusiones. A continuación, estudiaremos diferentes grupos de alimentos y categorizaremos los alimentos en una tabla. Esto nos dará una comprensión más clara de lo que hace una comida equilibrada, lo que será útil para el desafío de la unidad. Luego, consideraremos el impacto ambiental de nuestros alimentos, especialmente las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero (GEI), que pueden afectar significativamente a nuestro planeta. Para comunicar nuestros hallazgos, crearemos folletos de "huella alimentaria" de carbono, una forma educativa y atractiva de compartir información sobre el impacto ambiental de nuestras elecciones alimentarias.

ChapterDescription: Students work on the unit challenge by planning nutritionally-balanced menus with low carbon footprints. They write reports to explain their menu choices and then share their recipes in a gallery walk. The final assessment checks for understanding of the core ideas of photosynthesis, respiration, and chemical reactions.
ChapterDescriptionStident: It's time for the unit challenge! With ample time to research and plan, we'll create a nutritionally balanced menu with a low carbon footprint. This will be a chance to experiment with recipes at home and to gauge your family’s responses to your choices. Once the menus are decided, you will create a report explaining your decisions. We'll also get to look at other students' recipes, perhaps even trying some of them at home. Then we’ll put this together to create a classroom cookbook of low carbon footprint recipes that we can share with our families!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: ¡Es hora del desafío de la unidad! Con tiempo suficiente para investigar y planificar, crearemos un menú nutricionalmente equilibrado con una huella de carbono baja. Esta será una oportunidad para experimentar con recetas en casa y evaluar las respuestas de nuestra familia a nuestras elecciones. Una vez que se decidan los menús, crearemos un informe explicando nuestras decisiones. También podremos ver las recetas de otros estudiantes, ¡incluso probando algunas de ellas en casa! ¡Luego reuniremos todo esto para hacer un libro de cocina de la clase de recetas de baja huella de carbono que podremos compartir con nuestras familias!

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment and are introduced to the phenomenon of soil depletion. The unit challenge is introduced: to identify practical and sustainable ways to help protect our soil. Students prepare mini worm farms to be monitored over the next few weeks. Authentic data is studied showing factors driving soil loss. The data focuses on the world’s population increase and how farming practices reflect increased food demand.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Most people don’t think about soil too much, but it’s an incredibly important topic for the world! First, we’ll examine the concept of soil depletion and start thinking about our unit challenge to develop ways to protect our soil. You will love preparing and monitoring mini worm farms. These little wriggly creatures will become your partners in transforming household waste into something wonderful. It's like having your very own ecosystem at school! And since we all love—and need—food, we’ll see how vital, and sometimes how challenging, it is for farmers to produce enough food to meet the demands of a rising world population.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: La mayoría de las personas no piensan demasiado en el suelo, ¡pero es un tema increíblemente importante para el mundo! Primero, examinaremos el concepto de agotamiento del suelo y comenzaremos a pensar en nuestro desafío de unidad para desarrollar formas de proteger nuestro suelo. Te encantará preparar y monitorear mini granjas de lombrices. Estas pequeñas criaturas ondulantes se convertirán en tus socios para transformar los desechos domésticos en algo maravilloso. ¡Es como tener tu propio ecosistema en la escuela! Y como todos amamos, y necesitamos, la comida, veremos lo vital y, a veces, lo desafiante que es para los agricultores producir suficiente alimento para satisfacer las demandas de una población mundial en aumento.

Spanish Chapter Name: El Suelo: Lo Bueno y lo No Tan Bueno
ChapterDescription: Students learn of the importance of organic material in soil. They analyze and compare soil samples from various locations, and research factors affecting soil quality to compile a list. Afterwards, they design and set up experiments to determine how these various factors affect plant growth for ongoing monitoring.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, you get the chance to get your hands dirty by exploring how soils affect plant growth. First, you'll become soil detectives, analyzing and comparing soil samples from different places. Then, it's time to put on your scientist hats and research factors that supercharge soil for plants. You'll create a list of these factors and their importance, and then you'll be challenged to design experiments to uncover how these factors affect plant growth. In your own mini-gardens, you'll nurture and observe plants, measuring their height, counting leaves, and recording their progress over time. Finally, you'll have answers to the mysteries of how soil quality can assist plants to thrive.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, tendrás la oportunidad de ensuciarte las manos explorando cómo los suelos afectan el crecimiento de las plantas. Primero, te convertirás en un detective del suelo, analizando y comparando muestras de suelo de diferentes lugares. Luego, es hora de ponerse el sombrero de científico e investigar los factores que impulsan el suelo para las plantas. Crearás una lista de estos factores y su importancia, y luego te desafiarás a diseñar experimentos para descubrir cómo estos factores afectan el crecimiento de las plantas. En tus propios mini jardines, nutrirás y observarás plantas, midiendo su altura, contando hojas y registrando su progreso con el tiempo. Finalmente, tendrás respuestas a los misterios de cómo la calidad del suelo puede ayudar a las plantas a prosperar.

Spanish Chapter Name: Energía y Materia en los Ecosistemas
ChapterDescription: Students begin an exploration of the living and non-living components of ecosystems. They develop models to describe the movement of matter and energy, and investigate what takes place during decomposition. They then complete Unit Concept Checkpoint #1. Students model a decomposition chemical reaction using manipulatives, perform an experiment to illustrate the law of conservation of matter, and create a model to prove that matter is conserved during a chemical reaction. Following this, they make revisions to their original models if necessary.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we’ll study ecosystems and the fascinating processes that sustain them. You'll start by uncovering the secrets of living and non-living components in these ecosystems, and you'll build models to show how matter and energy flow through ecosystems. You’ll also investigate the magical process of decomposition, which includes hands-on action as you create a model that simulates a decomposition chemical reaction. Decomposition is a critical part of how soil is created, so understanding how it works helps us better understand how to care for our soil.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, estudiaremos los ecosistemas y los fascinantes procesos que los sostienen. Comenzarás descubriendo los secretos de los componentes vivos y no vivos en estos ecosistemas, y construirás modelos para mostrar cómo la materia y la energía fluyen a través de los ecosistemas. También investigarás el proceso mágico de la descomposición, que incluye acción práctica mientras creas un modelo que simula una reacción química de descomposición. La descomposición es una parte crítica de cómo se crea el suelo, por lo que comprender cómo funciona nos ayuda a cuidar mejor nuestro suelo.

ChapterDescription: Students analyze the soil in their worm farms and then research ecosystem services. They then share their findings in a jigsaw activity. The concept of biodiversity in ecosystems is introduced leading to an activity that models ecosystem disruptions and allows students to consider the importance of biodiversity in maintaining ecosystem services. Students perform a final analysis of the Bad Soil Investigation and share their findings with the class. A soil body of knowledge helps to organize information, and also prepares students for the culminating activity. The chapter concludes with Unit Concept Checkpoint #2.
ChapterDescriptionStident: By the end of this chapter, we aim to develop a ‘soil body of knowledge,’ where we describe everything we’ve learned about soil to help us prepare for the unit challenges - to restore a soil ecosystem. To get there, you’ll have the chance to check in on your worm farms, analyze data from your soil investigation, and explore how different ecosystems provide different services. Then we’ll share all our discoveries, and as a class, we'll build a soil body of knowledge to organize all the information we’ve gathered.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Al final de este capítulo, nuestro objetivo es desarrollar un "cuerpo de conocimiento del suelo", donde describamos todo lo que hemos aprendido sobre el suelo para ayudarnos a prepararnos para los desafíos de la unidad: restaurar un ecosistema del suelo. Para llegar allí, tendrás la oportunidad de revisar tus granjas de lombrices, analizar datos de tu investigación de suelo y explorar cómo diferentes ecosistemas proporcionan diferentes servicios. Luego compartiremos todos nuestros descubrimientos, y como clase, construiremos un cuerpo de conocimiento del suelo para organizar toda la información que hemos reunido.

ChapterDescription: Students are now ready to begin the culminating activity focused on restoring damaged soil ecosystems. They research the problems specific to their soil ecosystem. Teams meet to establish criteria and constraints for their designs, to develop and evaluate solutions, and to create posters to communicate their designs. While sharing their solutions, students receive evaluations from peers. Writing soil haikus gives students time to reflect on the role of science in decision-making. The unit concludes with an assessment and a celebration of the unit through sharing soil haikus with the class.
ChapterDescriptionStident: For the final chapter, it’s time to put your knowledge and creativity to the test to help restore a soil ecosystem. Begin by researching the specific challenges facing your soil ecosystem. As teams, come together to set criteria and constraints for your designs, brainstorm and evaluate solutions, and create effective posters to communicate your innovative designs. A final showcase will exhibit all the skills and knowledge gained through the unit and allow you to share and receive valuable evaluations. We’ve learned about the importance of soil in our world, and now we’ve designed some solutions to protect soil for future generations.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Para el capítulo final, es hora de poner a prueba tus conocimientos y creatividad para ayudar a restaurar un ecosistema del suelo. Comienza investigando los desafíos específicos que enfrenta tu ecosistema del suelo. Como equipos, unámonos para establecer criterios y restricciones para tus diseños, intercambiar ideas y evaluar soluciones y crear carteles efectivos para comunicar tus diseños innovadores. Una exhibición final exhibirá todas las habilidades y conocimientos adquiridos a través de la unidad y te permitirá compartir y recibir evaluaciones valiosas. Hemos aprendido sobre la importancia del suelo en nuestro mundo, y ahora hemos diseñado algunas soluciones para proteger el suelo para las generaciones futuras.

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment, then watch a video about Hurricane Katrina and receive the unit challenge: To create solutions to mitigate and adapt to flooding. A jigsaw activity allows students to share their analyses of data sets showing factors of flooding—precipitation, storm surge, and rise in sea level. Students then create graphic organizers to summarize patterns, common factors, damages caused, and other potential similarities among the phenomena.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Welcome to a new unit where you'll work on the challenge of creating solutions to mitigate and adapt to flooding. We'll start with a video about Hurricane Katrina, and you'll dive into datasets that reveal the factors contributing to flooding—precipitation, storm surge, and sea-level rise. Using a jigsaw activity, you'll share your findings and begin to explore patterns and similarities between these phenomena. With your graphic organizers, you'll summarize the damaging impacts and shared factors among these events.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Bienvenidos a una nueva unidad en la que trabajarán en el desafío de crear soluciones para mitigar y adaptarse a las inundaciones. Comenzaremos con un video sobre el huracán Katrina, y se sumergirán en conjuntos de datos que revelan los factores que contribuyen a las inundaciones, como la precipitación, la marejada ciclónica y el aumento del nivel del mar. Utilizando una actividad de rompecabezas, compartirán sus hallazgos y comenzarán a explorar patrones y similitudes entre estos fenómenos. Con sus organizadores gráficos, resumirán los impactos dañinos y los factores compartidos entre estos eventos.

ChapterDescription: Having seen the consequences of an increase in precipitation and other water-related phenomena, students turn to forecasting and preventing these impacts. Through an online simulation, they see how changes in thermal energy produce changes in the physical state of water, driving the processes that cause flooding. Students create concept maps or models that describe changes of state when thermal energy is added or removed from water. Using different scenarios, students revise their models. A final quiz covers the concepts from this chapter.
ChapterDescriptionStident: After examining the consequences of increased precipitation and other water-related phenomena, we'll shift our focus to forecasting and preventing these impacts. You'll use an online simulation to understand how changes in thermal energy influence the state of water, contributing to the processes that cause flooding. Creating concept maps or models, you'll depict changes of state when thermal energy is added or removed from water. By applying different scenarios, you'll revise your models, providing a solid foundation for our work on the unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Después de examinar las consecuencias del aumento de la precipitación y otros fenómenos relacionados con el agua, cambiaremos nuestro enfoque hacia la predicción y prevención de estos impactos. Utilizarán una simulación en línea para comprender cómo los cambios en la energía térmica influyen en el estado del agua, contribuyendo a los procesos que causan inundaciones. Creando mapas conceptuales o modelos, representarán los cambios de estado cuando se agrega o se elimina energía térmica del agua. Al aplicar diferentes escenarios, revisarán sus modelos, lo que proporcionará una base sólida para nuestro trabajo en el desafío de la unidad.

ChapterDescription: Students expand their concept models to represent the connection between global temperature increases and flooding, exploring the phenomenon of sea level rise due to thermal expansion. They graph their data and compare it to data collected by scientists. Students then find ways to describe to friends or family members the effects of sea-level rise due to thermal expansion, and to explain why people should be concerned that it is happening. The significance of storm surges as a contributor to flooding in coastal areas is discovered.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we'll broaden our concept models to show the connection between global temperature increases and flooding. We'll delve into sea-level rise due to thermal expansion, and you'll graph data, comparing it with real-world scientific data. Furthermore, we'll discuss the significance of storm surges in contributing to coastal flooding. Your task will be to convey to friends or family members why we should be concerned about thermal expansion and sea-level rise—crucial concepts in preparing for our unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, ampliaremos nuestros modelos conceptuales para mostrar la conexión entre el aumento de la temperatura global y las inundaciones. Profundizaremos en el aumento del nivel del mar debido a la expansión térmica, y graficarán datos comparándolos con datos científicos del mundo real. Además, discutiremos la importancia de las marejadas ciclónicas en la contribución a las inundaciones costeras. Su tarea será transmitir a amigos o familiares por qué deberíamos preocuparnos por la expansión térmica y el aumento del nivel del mar, conceptos cruciales para prepararnos para el desafío de la unidad.

ChapterDescription: Students participate in Unit Concept Checkpoint #1. Health effects of climate change are studied focusing on the impact of increased precipitation on reservoirs. Students identify mitigation strategies and predict events in their own communities. Water filters are designed, and the infrastructures of two cities are compared. In a simulated press conference, students state concerns about severe weather conditions. Physical models of riverbeds help students gain an understanding of how flooding affects communities. Floating gardens are planned as a food source after a flood.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we'll explore the impact of flooding on food supply and clean water. By designing water filters and comparing city infrastructures, you'll gain practical insights into strategies for maintaining and protecting access to clean water. You'll experience a simulated press conference, voicing concerns about severe weather conditions, and construct physical models of riverbeds to understand how flooding affects communities. As an innovative solution, you'll plan floating gardens as a food source after a flood—a concrete step towards preparing for your unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, exploraremos el impacto de las inundaciones en el suministro de alimentos y agua potable. Diseñando filtros de agua y comparando infraestructuras de la ciudad, obtendrán ideas prácticas sobre estrategias para mantener y proteger el acceso al agua limpia. Vivirán una conferencia de prensa simulada, expresando preocupaciones sobre las condiciones climáticas extremas, y construirán modelos físicos de lechos de ríos para comprender cómo las inundaciones afectan a las comunidades. Como una solución innovadora, planificarán jardines flotantes como fuente de alimento después de una inundación, un paso concreto hacia la preparación para su desafío de unidad.

ChapterDescription: The distinction between climate change adaptation and mitigation is made. Students graph data projecting rising sea levels to evaluate various adaptation strategies. Students assume the role of a state official keeping Louisiana safe in the event of a rise in sea level. New Orleans is presented as a case study, and student pairs receive information cards to explore adaptation strategies best suited to New Orleans.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this short chapter, you'll explore the distinction between climate change adaptation and mitigation, and then you'll graph data projecting rising sea levels and evaluate various adaptation strategies. Taking on the role of a state official, you'll strategize keeping Louisiana safe amidst potential sea-level rise, using New Orleans as a case study. These experiences will provide a unique perspective on creating adaptive strategies, furthering your progress towards preparing for the unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este breve capítulo, explorarán la distinción entre adaptación y mitigación del cambio climático, y luego graficarán datos proyectando el aumento del nivel del mar y evaluarán varias estrategias de adaptación. Tomando el papel de un funcionario estatal, diseñarán estrategias para mantener a Louisiana a salvo frente al potencial aumento del nivel del mar, utilizando Nueva Orleans como estudio de caso. Estas experiencias proporcionarán una perspectiva única sobre la creación de estrategias adaptativas, avanzando en su progreso hacia la preparación para el desafío de la unidad.

ChapterDescription: During a multi-day simulation, students engage in designing flood-resilient cities and responding to disasters. They assume roles representing different sectors and interpret data to become familiar with their fictional city. Working in sector groups, students select resources to mitigate the forecasted hazards before a severe storm strikes. Following the simulation, they reflect on their preparation and response. The unit concludes with an assessment, and discussion on global warming and flood risk.
ChapterDescriptionStident: We're reaching the end of the unit and it's time for the challenge - a multi-day simulation where you'll design flood-resilient cities and respond to disasters. By assuming roles in different sectors, you'll interpret data and familiarize yourself with your fictional city. You'll strategize and select resources to mitigate forecasted hazards before a severe storm hits. Reflecting on your preparations and responses after the simulation will give you critical insights for your final unit challenge. We'll conclude the unit with a discussion on global warming and flood risk, cementing your understanding before you finalize your flood mitigation and adaptation solutions.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Estamos llegando al final de la unidad y es hora del desafío: una simulación de varios días en la que diseñarán ciudades resistentes a las inundaciones y responderán a desastres. Asumiendo roles en diferentes sectores, interpretarán datos y se familiarizarán con su ciudad ficticia. Estrategizarán y seleccionarán recursos para mitigar los peligros pronosticados antes de que llegue una tormenta severa. Reflexionar sobre sus preparativos y respuestas después de la simulación les dará ideas críticas para su desafío final de la unidad. Concluiremos la unidad con una discusión sobre el calentamiento global y el riesgo de inundaciones, afianzando su comprensión antes de finalizar sus soluciones de mitigación y adaptación a las inundaciones.

ChapterDescription: This unit begins with a pre-asessment and an introduction to the unit challenge of protecting healthy ecosystems. Students begin an Ecosystem Notebook by designing a cover. They watch a video showing a way of life that is interconnected with healthy ecosystems. Then, students trace the trade routes of indigenous groups in California noting resources that were imported from other ecosystems. They consider criteria for selecting their ecosystem study location, then look at a scientific abstract focusing on the neurological benefits of being in nature. Finally, they practice observation skills in preparation for visiting the ecosystem study locations.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter starts with the unit challenge - protecting healthy ecosystems. You'll start your Ecosystem Notebook and watch a video that portrays a lifestyle deeply connected with healthy ecosystems. You'll also trace the trade routes of indigenous groups in California, noting resources imported from different ecosystems, and contemplate the criteria for choosing your ecosystem study location. The chapter concludes with a focus on the neurological benefits of being in nature.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo comienza con el desafío de la unidad: proteger ecosistemas saludables. Comenzarán su Cuaderno de Ecosistemas y verán un video que retrata un estilo de vida profundamente conectado con ecosistemas saludables. También rastrearán las rutas comerciales de los grupos indígenas en California, notando los recursos importados de diferentes ecosistemas, y contemplarán los criterios para elegir la ubicación de su estudio de ecosistemas. El capítulo concluye con un enfoque en los beneficios neurológicos de estar en la naturaleza.

ChapterDescription: Students are introduced to the components of an ecosystem. They identify and classify the components and identify interactions, relationships, and shared processes. Students consider how resource availability changes with the seasons, graphing data to analyze this. They recognize that the seasonal availability of resources affects populations throughout the year. Finally, students share reflections on their ecosystem study locations, and complete Unit Concept Checkpoint #1.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, you'll sharpen your observation skills in preparation for gathering data at your ecosystem study location. You'll dive into understanding the components of an ecosystem, their interactions, relationships, and shared processes. As you graph data to analyze seasonal changes in resource availability, you'll realize how these changes affect populations throughout the year. By reflecting on your ecosystem study locations, you'll be taking a critical step towards understanding and protecting the health of your selected ecosystem.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, afinarán sus habilidades de observación en preparación para recopilar datos en su ubicación de estudio de ecosistemas. Profundizarán en la comprensión de los componentes de un ecosistema, sus interacciones, relaciones y procesos compartidos. Al graficar datos para analizar los cambios estacionales en la disponibilidad de recursos, se darán cuenta de cómo estos cambios afectan a las poblaciones durante todo el año. Al reflexionar sobre sus ubicaciones de estudio de ecosistemas, estarán dando un paso crítico hacia la comprensión y protección de la salud de su ecosistema seleccionado.

ChapterDescription: Studnets investigate plate tectonics and other Earth processes and learn how the Santa Monica Mountains were formed. Students discover why the highest peak in the Santa Monica Mountains was misnamed, and how microscopic Earth processes change the Earth’s surface. Students then predict rapid changes in the landscape and study images to arrive at an explanation of the Earth processes that have changed the Earth’s surface in the past. This chapter concludes with Unit Concept Checkpoint #2.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, you’ll explore how Earth processes, such as plate tectonics, affect ecosystems, as seen in the Santa Monica Mountains. You'll investigate why the highest peak in these mountains was misnamed and how small Earth processes can bring about significant changes to the Earth's surface. By predicting rapid landscape changes and analyzing images, you'll develop an understanding of how Earth processes shape our world.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, explorarán cómo los procesos terrestres, como la tectónica de placas, afectan los ecosistemas, como se ve en las montañas de Santa Mónica. Investigarán por qué se malnombró el pico más alto de estas montañas y cómo los pequeños procesos terrestres pueden provocar cambios significativos en la superficie de la Tierra. Al predecir cambios rápidos en el paisaje y analizar imágenes, desarrollarán una comprensión de cómo los procesos terrestres dan forma a nuestro mundo.

ChapterDescription: Students are introduced to the practice of primary research, focusing on observing interactions between different organisms. They ask scientific questions, review ecological concepts, and, in a simulation, take on the roles of organisms within a healthy ecosystem. Students prepare for data collection at their ecosystem study locations by refining their scientific questions. They make visual represntations of data using data tables and line graphs. Lastly, students analyze their graphs, drawing inferences based on their data, their field observations, and their understanding of ecosystem dynamics.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter gets us ready to do some primary research. You'll focus on observing interactions between different organisms and generating scientific questions. Through a simulation, you'll experience the roles of organisms within a healthy ecosystem. As you prepare for data collection at your ecosystem study locations and create visual representations of your data, you'll be well-equipped to analyze your graphs and develop conclusions based on your observations and understanding of ecosystem dynamics.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo nos prepara para hacer investigación primaria. Se centrarán en observar las interacciones entre diferentes organismos y generar preguntas científicas. A través de una simulación, experimentarán los roles de los organismos dentro de un ecosistema saludable. Al prepararse para la recolección de datos en sus ubicaciones de estudio de ecosistemas y crear representaciones visuales de sus datos, estarán bien equipados para analizar sus gráficos y desarrollar conclusiones basadas en sus observaciones y comprensión de la dinámica del ecosistema.

ChapterDescription: The chapter begins with a data and research review on the impacts of climate change in ecosystems, helping students predict changes that may occur in their ecosystem study locations due to climate change. Students thus make connections between unit content and ecosystem study locations. The concept of introspection in scientific work is introduced when students conduct interviews with one another about their field research. The interviews also provide supporting material for the culminating experience.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, you'll review data and research on climate change impacts in ecosystems. This will help you predict potential changes in your ecosystem study location due to climate change. Furthermore, you'll engage in interviews with your peers about field research, providing supporting material for the unit's culminating experience.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, revisarán datos e investigaciones sobre los impactos del cambio climático en los ecosistemas. Esto les ayudará a predecir posibles cambios en su ubicación de estudio de ecosistemas debido al cambio climático. Además, participarán en entrevistas con sus compañeros sobre la investigación de campo, proporcionando material de apoyo para la experiencia culminante de la unidad.

ChapterDescription: To address the unit challenge, students write letters of thanks and support, with related documentation, to the owners or managers of their ecosystem study location areas. The format and purpose of a formal letter is reviewed, and students gather information to support the content of their letters. Letters are critiqued by peers before the final copies are completed. Students are encouraged to mail their letters to the relevant organization in order to help develop an awareness of being active citizens. A post-assessment and reflection conclude the unit.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this final chapter, you'll now tackle the unit challenge. You are going to use the data you collected to help you write letters of appreciation and support to the caretakers of your ecosystem study locations. After reviewing the format and purpose of a formal letter, you'll gather relevant information and receive peer feedback before finalizing your letter. The goal is to mail these letters so that your message gets shared with others who have an interest in protecting these ecosystems.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo final, abordarán el desafío de la unidad. Utilizarán los datos que recolectaron para ayudarles a escribir cartas de agradecimiento y apoyo a los cuidadores de sus ubicaciones de estudio de ecosistemas. Después de revisar el formato y el propósito de una carta formal, recopilarán información relevante y recibirán comentarios de sus compañeros antes de finalizar su carta. El objetivo es enviar estas cartas para que su mensaje sea compartido con otros que tengan interés en proteger estos ecosistemas.

Spanish Chapter Name: Posición de la Tierra en la Órbita
ChapterDescription: Students engage in an icebreaker game, Carbon Runner, which simulates energy-related decision-making, setting the tone for a sustainable future. A distant view of Earth, through a NASA camera, stimulates discussion. Students develop strategies for Earth's protection and take a pre-assessment to check on prior knowledge. They create visual representations of the Earth-Sun-moon relationship, then explore non-contact forces and gravity's role in galaxies and the solar system. Further studies include asteroids and the likelihood of asteroid collisions.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This unit will help us explore Earth's history and place in our vast universe to understand our planet's importance and its need for preservation. Our journey starts with a captivating NASA image of our planet. We'll learn about Earth's relationships with the Sun and moon, explore non-contact forces, and uncover the role of gravity in moving celestial objects. We'll also discuss the intriguing topic of asteroids and their potential risks to Earth, all of which will aid in our unit challenge of planning for a sustainable future.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Esta unidad nos ayudará a explorar la historia de la Tierra y su lugar en nuestro vasto universo para comprender la importancia de nuestro planeta y su necesidad de preservación. Nuestro viaje comienza con una cautivadora imagen de la NASA de nuestro planeta. Aprenderemos sobre las relaciones de la Tierra con el Sol y la Luna, exploraremos fuerzas no contactantes y descubriremos el papel de la gravedad en el movimiento de objetos celestes. También discutiremos el intrigante tema de los asteroides y sus posibles riesgos para la Tierra, todo lo cual nos ayudará en nuestro desafío de unidad de planificar un futuro sostenible.

Spanish Chapter Name: Leyendo la Historia de la Tierra
ChapterDescription: Evidence of ancient impacts is found in Earth's rock layers, and students use a model of the layers to simulate tectonic plate movement. They develop storyboards to illustrate a region's geologic record, and apply their new knowledge by participating in virtual geological field work. Students look for evidence of space rock in rock layers and look at fossils in the area to discover major disruptions to life. Finally, they draw conclusions about the incidence of asteroid collisions with Earth throughout history.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we dive into Earth's past by studying geology. We'll learn how ancient impacts have shaped our planet by investigating Earth's rock layers and tectonic plate interactions, which can lead to mountains, oceans, earthquakes, and volcanic eruptions. We'll virtually visit real-world sites, discover space rock evidence, and investigate major disruptions that affected ancient life. By linking asteroid impacts to Earth's evolution, we'll understand more about our planet's fascinating history.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, nos sumergimos en el pasado de la Tierra estudiando la geología. Aprenderemos cómo los impactos antiguos han dado forma a nuestro planeta investigando las capas de roca de la Tierra y las interacciones de las placas tectónicas, que pueden dar lugar a montañas, océanos, terremotos y erupciones volcánicas. Visitaremos sitios del mundo real virtualmente, descubriremos pruebas de rocas espaciales e investigaremos las principales interrupciones que afectaron la vida antigua. Al vincular los impactos de asteroides con la evolución de la Tierra, entenderemos más sobre la fascinante historia de nuestro planeta.

ChapterDescription: As an introduction to the analysis of asteroid collisions, students perform experiments based on Newton’s Laws of Motion. Students conduct an experiment and create a model showing how Newton's Third Law of Motion can be used to prevent an asteroid collision with Earth. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 is completed in this chapter.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter takes us into the world of Sir Isaac Newton and his Laws of Motion. Through experiments, we'll explore concepts like inertia and acceleration, and see how Newton's Third Law of Motion might prevent an asteroid collision with Earth. Our exploration of motion will boost our problem-solving skills and build our understanding of how to protect our planet from potential space threats.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo nos lleva al mundo de Sir Isaac Newton y sus Leyes del Movimiento. A través de experimentos, exploraremos conceptos como la inercia y la aceleración, y veremos cómo la Tercera Ley del Movimiento de Newton puede evitar una colisión de asteroides con la Tierra. Nuestra exploración del movimiento mejorará nuestras habilidades para resolver problemas y construirá nuestra comprensión de cómo proteger nuestro planeta de posibles amenazas espaciales.

ChapterDescription: Students are introduced to scratch programming software and practice with some examples to develop programming skills. They move on to applying their knowledge of collisions and Newton’s Laws of Motion while developing basic animations or simulations.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Here we shift gears a bit and venture into the realm of programming. We'll use our recent understanding of Newton’s Laws of Motion and apply them to animations or simulations of colliding objects in space. We’ll learn how to develop and code these objects, considering all components of the system and their interactions. This task will reinforce our knowledge about collisions and motion, which will support our unit challenge of planning for a sustainable future.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Aquí cambiamos un poco de rumbo y nos adentramos en el mundo de la programación. Utilizaremos nuestra comprensión reciente de las Leyes del Movimiento de Newton y las aplicaremos a animaciones o simulaciones de objetos colisionando en el espacio. Aprenderemos a desarrollar y codificar estos objetos, considerando todos los componentes del sistema y sus interacciones. Esta tarea reforzará nuestro conocimiento sobre colisiones y movimiento, lo que apoyará nuestro desafío de unidad de planificar un futuro sostenible.

Spanish Chapter Name: La Tierra a través de las Edades
ChapterDescription: Students read an article which helps them consider a new epoch. They then construct arguments about this classification. Unit Concept Checkpoint #2 follows. The unit’s culminating experience is introduced: an animation about protecting the Earth. After gathering information, groups plan and create animations using Scratch, with descriptions for their viewers. To conclude, students present their animations and explanations. Finally, students take an assessment and learn about an inspiring geologist.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter opens up with a thought-provoking topic: the idea of a new epoch, a period marking significant changes in Earth's ecosystems and geology. We'll weigh the evidence for and against this concept, forming our own well-supported arguments. We'll then focus on our work addressing the unit challenge by creating compelling animations about Earth protection, explaining its history and possible future. By showcasing our work, we'll inspire others to see the value in actions that can protect our planet.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo comienza con un tema provocador: la idea de una nueva época, un período que marca cambios significativos en los ecosistemas y la geología de la Tierra. Evaluaremos las pruebas a favor y en contra de este concepto, formando nuestros propios argumentos bien fundamentados. Luego, nos enfocaremos en nuestro trabajo abordando el desafío de unidad creando animaciones convincentes sobre la protección de la Tierra, explicando su historia y posible futuro. Al mostrar nuestro trabajo, inspiraremos a otros a ver el valor en acciones que pueden proteger nuestro planeta.

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment and receive the unit challenge: To appreciate the history and diversity of life on Earth. They address the human causes of the next mass extinction. A video introduces the fossil record, geologic time, and mass extinction. Students create a personal timeline, and are introduced to the art of writing visual stories to communicate scientific concepts. Students make molds and cast body fossils to model the formation of fossils within rock layers. Scientific study protocols are used for analyzing fossils, and determining the place of a fossil in the fossil record.
ChapterDescriptionStident: The challenge in this unit is to uncover clues from the evolution of life on Earth to prevent the next mass extinction. This hands-on, minds-on adventure combines science, history, and creativity. We’ll start by exploring the fossil record, geologic time, and mass extinctions, and then we’ll create our own personal timelines, tracing the important events in our lives, much like we can do for human history. We’ll then get busy making molds and casting body fossils, simulating how fossils form within rock layers. Following scientific study protocols, we'll analyze these fossils and determine their place in the grand fossil record. So, let’s get ready to explore the wonders of Earth like never before.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: El desafío de esta unidad es descubrir pistas de la evolución de la vida en la Tierra para evitar la próxima extinción masiva. Esta aventura práctica y mental combina ciencia, historia y creatividad. Comenzaremos explorando el registro fósil, el tiempo geológico y las extinciones masivas, y luego crearemos nuestras propias líneas de tiempo personales, rastreando los eventos importantes en nuestras vidas, de la misma manera que podemos hacerlo para la historia humana. Luego, nos ocuparemos de hacer moldes y fundir fósiles corporales, simulando cómo se forman los fósiles dentro de las capas de roca. Siguiendo los protocolos de estudio científico, analizaremos estos fósiles y determinaremos su lugar en el gran registro fósil. Así que, prepárate para explorar las maravillas de la Tierra como nunca antes.

ChapterDescription: Students explore the evolution of simple to complex life over time, using the fossil record. A special skills lesson gives practice in accurately citing sources. A multi-day project involves researching and creating newspaper articles announcing new evolutionary traits. Students review their peers' reports, deepening their own understanding. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 is found in this chapter, and the chapter concludes with a search for patterns in the existence and diversity of life on Earth.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we’ll examine evolution by unlocking the secrets of how life has transformed from simple creatures to complex organisms, all through the amazing fossil record. We'll develop some special skills along the way as we learn the art of accurately citing our sources, like real scientists. We'll even become reporters for a few days as we research and create newspaper articles that announce newly discovered evolutionary traits in different species. The wrap-up to the chapter explores patterns in the incredible diversity of life on Earth and what this means for the future.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, examinaremos la evolución desbloqueando los secretos de cómo la vida se ha transformado de criaturas simples a organismos complejos, todo a través del increíble registro fósil. Desarrollaremos algunas habilidades especiales en el camino mientras aprendemos el arte de citar con precisión nuestras fuentes, como hacen los verdaderos científicos. Incluso nos convertiremos en reporteros por unos días mientras investigamos y creamos artículos de periódico que anuncian rasgos evolutivos recién descubiertos en diferentes especies. El cierre del capítulo explora los patrones en la increíble diversidad de la vida en la Tierra y lo que esto significa para el futuro.

ChapterDescription: Students note anatomical similarities and differences between modern and fossil organisms to infer evolutionary relationships. A game that represents the genetic “master plan" introduces comparative embryonic development. A set of directions is followed to create creatures, showing the hierarchy of genetic coding as embryos form. Students write narratives about the evolutionary histories and future survival of their new creatures. They connect embryonic development to the physical traits that may enable their organisms to survive a natural disaster.
ChapterDescriptionStident: As budding scientists in this chapter, we’ll embark on a quest to uncover the secrets hidden within the anatomy of modern and fossil organisms. By observing their similarities and differences, we can unravel the intricate web of evolution. We’ll play a game of Telephone and you may be surprised and amused at the results. Through comparing embryonic development, we'll witness how organisms share common traits during their early stages of life. In a follow-up experiment, we’ll follow a set of directions to create unique creatures. Once more, storytelling will be our focus as we let our imaginations run wild, writing narratives about the evolutionary histories and future survival of our newly formed creatures. We’ll then connect the dots between embryonic development and the physical traits that could help our organisms survive a natural disaster.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Como científicos en ciernes en este capítulo, nos embarcaremos en una búsqueda para descubrir los secretos ocultos dentro de la anatomía de los organismos modernos y fósiles. Al observar sus similitudes y diferencias, podemos desentrañar la intrincada red de la evolución. Jugaremos un juego de Teléfono y es posible que te sorprendas y diviertas con los resultados. A través de la comparación del desarrollo embrionario, presenciaremos cómo los organismos comparten rasgos comunes durante sus primeras etapas de vida. En un experimento de seguimiento, seguiremos un conjunto de instrucciones para crear criaturas únicas. Una vez más, la narración será nuestro enfoque mientras dejamos volar nuestra imaginación, escribiendo narrativas sobre las historias evolutivas y la supervivencia futura de nuestras criaturas recién formadas. Luego conectaremos los puntos entre el desarrollo embrionario y los rasgos físicos que podrían ayudar a nuestros organismos a sobrevivir a un desastre natural.

ChapterDescription: Kinesthetic activities introduce mass extinctions. Students research the history, causes, and effects of the five past mass extinctions and look for clues about how to survive. Groups report and reflect on their mass extinction research, using visual representations to share their information. The diversity of life strategies, fitness, and luck leading to survival or extinction are evaluated in a dice game. Students identify the top causes of the impending sixth extinction, and consider their own role in finding solutions to environmental issues. Students complete Unit Concept Checkpoint #2.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we focus on mass extinctions. We’ll explore the history, causes, and effects of the five past mass extinctions, and we'll search for clues on how to survive. Teamwork will be important as we research these catastrophic events and share our findings using visual representations. A dice game will put our knowledge to the test. We'll then evaluate the diversity of life strategies, fitness, and even luck, all factors that determine survival or extinction. It's a game of chance that will keep us on our toes as we navigate the challenges faced by different species. As we become more aware of the impending sixth extinction, it's time to reflect on our own role in finding solutions to environmental issues. Together, we'll identify the top causes of this threat and understand how human actions can contribute to or prevent further harm. We have the power to make a difference, and it's up to us to take action and protect the diversity of life on Earth.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, nos enfocamos en las extinciones masivas. Exploraremos la historia, las causas y los efectos de las cinco extinciones masivas pasadas, y buscaremos pistas sobre cómo sobrevivir. El trabajo en equipo será importante mientras investigamos estos eventos catastróficos y compartimos nuestros hallazgos utilizando representaciones visuales. Un juego de dados pondrá a prueba nuestro conocimiento. Luego evaluaremos la diversidad de estrategias de vida, aptitud e incluso suerte, todos factores que determinan la supervivencia o extinción. Es un juego de azar que nos mantendrá alerta mientras navegamos por los desafíos enfrentados por diferentes especies. A medida que nos damos cuenta de la sexta extinción inminente, es hora de reflexionar sobre nuestro propio papel en la búsqueda de soluciones a los problemas ambientales. Juntos, identificaremos las principales causas de esta amenaza y entenderemos cómo las acciones humanas pueden contribuir a prevenir daños adicionales. Tenemos el poder de hacer la diferencia, y depende de nosotros tomar medidas y proteger la diversidad de la vida en la Tierra.

ChapterDescription: The unit challenge begins with brainstorming and storyboarding. A rubric is provided for the students to follow. Final copies of their visual stories are handed in, after which students review and reflect on the culminating experience. A group discussion is held to consider what motivates people to take action on environmental issues. From this, students identify creative environmental solutions that they can implement. A post-assessment and a reflection conclude the unit.
ChapterDescriptionStident: We’ve now reached the end of the unit, and it’s time to use the tools and knowledge we've gained to face our final challenge - to help prevent the next mass extinction. In teams, we're going to create visual stories about how one particular species may or may not adapt to new changes in the environment. For your story to be effective, you’ll need to combine good storytelling and good science, but you’ll have plenty of help from other students and from a rubric to guide you. At the end of the unit, we’ll get to see other students' stories and reflect on how we all have the ability to create change.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Ahora hemos llegado al final de la unidad, y es hora de usar las herramientas y el conocimiento que hemos adquirido para enfrentar nuestro desafío final: ayudar a evitar la próxima extinción masiva. En equipos, crearemos historias visuales sobre cómo una especie particular puede o no adaptarse a nuevos cambios en el medio ambiente. Para que tu historia sea efectiva, deberás combinar buena narración y buena ciencia, pero tendrás mucha ayuda de otros estudiantes y de una rúbrica que te guiará. Al final de la unidad, veremos las historias de otros estudiantes y reflexionaremos sobre cómo todos tenemos la capacidad de crear cambios.

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment and are introduced to the unit challenge: To learn more about creating a sustainable planet. They view satellite images to evaluate human impacts on Earth’s systems, and view a graph indicating how different countries consume different amounts of resources. Students collect data on how much they personally consume and then take an ecological footprint quiz, comparing their own results with those of other countries. After viewing a video, students construct a claim about how consumption impacts Earth's systems.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this unit, we're taking on a big challenge – reducing humanity's ecological footprint on Earth. We'll start by looking at satellite images to evaluate the impacts we're having on Earth's systems. We'll study a graph showing consumption patterns in different countries, and you'll collect data on your personal consumption. After an ecological footprint quiz, you'll compare your results to those of other countries. By viewing a video, you'll gain insights on how our consumption impacts Earth's systems.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En esta unidad, nos enfrentamos a un gran desafío: reducir la huella ecológica de la humanidad en la Tierra. Comenzaremos por examinar imágenes satelitales para evaluar los impactos que estamos teniendo en los sistemas de la Tierra. Estudiaremos un gráfico que muestra los patrones de consumo en diferentes países y recopilarás datos sobre tu consumo personal. Después de realizar un cuestionario sobre la huella ecológica, compararás tus resultados con los de otros países. Al ver un video, obtendrás información sobre cómo nuestro consumo afecta los sistemas de la Tierra.

ChapterDescription: This chapter turns to the study of satellites and their use of waves to provide images that give insights about Earth. Students also explore other areas where waves are used. They conducts experiments using a variety of materials to show what waves are and lead to a definition for waves. A surfing simulation helps students understand wave characteristics, showing the relationships between amplitude, frequency, wavelength, and wave energy. Afterwards, students take a quiz to assesses their understanding of waves, and then apply this knowledge to sound and light.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we're going to take a closer look at satellites and how they use waves to give us insights about Earth. Through experiments with different materials, you'll discover what waves are and define their key characteristics. By participating in a surfing simulation, you'll better understand the relationships between amplitude, frequency, wavelength, and wave energy. After a quiz to check your understanding of waves, we'll see how this knowledge applies to sound and light.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, examinaremos más de cerca los satélites y cómo utilizan las ondas para darnos información sobre la Tierra. A través de experimentos con diferentes materiales, descubrirás qué son las ondas y definirás sus características principales. Al participar en una simulación de surf, comprenderás mejor las relaciones entre la amplitud, la frecuencia, la longitud de onda y la energía de las ondas. Después de hacer un cuestionario para comprobar tu comprensión de las ondas, veremos cómo este conocimiento se aplica al sonido y la luz.

Spanish Chapter Name: Comportamiento de las Ondas y Satélites
ChapterDescription: Students investigate wave absorption, transmission, and reflection through hands-on stations before coming up with class definitions. They then use a variety of materials to develop models of absorption, transmission, and reflection. A quiz assesses their understanding of wave behavior. Afterwards, students are introduced to the abilities of human-designed satellites. A case study of a scientist converting satellite data into sound leads into student experimentation with their own sound-to-data projects.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we’ll prepare to dig deeper into wave absorption, transmission, and reflection. You'll explore these concepts through hands-on activities and create class definitions for each. Next, using a variety of materials, you'll face the challenge of developing models of absorption, transmission, and reflection. We'll check your understanding of wave behavior before introducing you to the amazing abilities of human-designed satellites. Inspired by a case study of a scientist converting satellite data into sound, you'll get a chance to experiment with your own sound-to-data project and reflect on how satellites help us see the unseen.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, nos prepararemos para profundizar en la absorción, transmisión y reflexión de ondas. Explorarás estos conceptos a través de actividades prácticas y crearás definiciones para cada uno en clase. Luego, utilizando una variedad de materiales, te enfrentarás al desafío de desarrollar modelos de absorción, transmisión y reflexión. Comprobaremos tu comprensión del comportamiento de las ondas antes de presentarte las increíbles habilidades de los satélites diseñados por humanos. Inspirado por un estudio de caso de un científico que convierte datos satelitales en sonido, tendrás la oportunidad de experimentar con tu propio proyecto de sonido a datos y reflexionar sobre cómo los satélites nos ayudan a ver lo invisible.

ChapterDescription: In this three-part lesson series, students investigate analog and digital signals to compare the features of both. Students participate in a lab, working through a series of stations. They watch a video, after which they create and compare graphs of analog diagrams and their encoded digital forms. The information gained from this chapter is used to support claims about which type of signal is more reliable for encoding and transmitting information.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we’ll go deeper into how satellites work by exploring the use of analog and digital signals. In this three-part series, we'll explore both types of signals and compare their features. You'll participate in a lab, create graphs of analog and digital signals, and use this knowledge to argue which type of signal is more reliable for encoding and transmitting information, like from a satellite. As we think about the unit challenge, we’ll realize how valuable satellite information can be for monitoring our planet and thinking about solutions to environmental challenges.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, profundizaremos en cómo funcionan los satélites explorando el uso de señales analógicas y digitales. En esta serie de tres partes, exploraremos ambos tipos de señales y compararemos sus características. Participarás en un laboratorio, crearás gráficos de señales analógicas y digitales, y utilizarás este conocimiento para argumentar qué tipo de señal es más confiable para codificar y transmitir información, como la de un satélite. Al pensar en el desafío de la unidad, nos daremos cuenta de lo valiosa que puede ser la información satelital para monitorear nuestro planeta y pensar en soluciones a los desafíos ambientales.

ChapterDescription: Satellites are highlighted as students develop animations about the use of waves. Students design storyboards for stories or games, create sprites, and then develop animations using Scratch. Finally, students will share their animations, and receive feedback from their peers. The chapter concludes with a class debrief covering satellites and the process of animation. This chapter includes Unit Concept Checkpoint #1.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Prepare to get creative in this chapter! We'll focus on satellites and use them as inspiration for designing animations. You'll plan a story or game, design sprites, and develop animations using Scratch. After sharing your creations, you'll give and receive feedback from your classmates. We'll wrap up the chapter with a discussion on satellites and how animation can be a valuable tool to explain to others how satellites work.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: ¡Prepárate para ser creativo en este capítulo! Nos centraremos en los satélites y los usaremos como inspiración para diseñar animaciones. Planificarás una historia o juego, diseñarás sprites y desarrollarás animaciones usando Scratch. Después de compartir tus creaciones, darás y recibirás comentarios de tus compañeros de clase. Concluiremos el capítulo con una discusión sobre los satélites y cómo la animación puede ser una herramienta valiosa para explicar a otros cómo funcionan los satélites.

ChapterDescription: For the unit’s culminating experience, students create motivational infographics for reducing ecological footprints. A rubric guides the process. The concept of social math is introduced as students analyze infographics and select their areas of focus. Upon completing their work, students share their final infographics and receive peer feedback. Afterwards, students trace the evolution of acoustics and sound recording, then think of how to reduce their own ecological “sound” footprint. Finally, a post-assessment and gallery walk provide opportunites for students to demonstrate what they have learned from the unit.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this final chapter, you'll apply everything you've learned to create infographics that inspire people to reduce their ecological footprint. Infographics typically rely on data, and you’ll be encouraged to leverage satellite data to make compelling claims based on real-world data. You'll analyze existing infographics and use the concept of social math to select your areas of focus. The final infographics will be shared for feedback, and after time to make revisions, you’ll have a gallery walk where you'll showcase your learning from the unit and see the work of other students. This is an opportunity to see the diversity of approaches possible for sharing an important message based on scientific data.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo final, aplicarás todo lo que has aprendido para crear infografías que inspiren a la gente a reducir su huella ecológica. Las infografías suelen depender de datos, y serás animado a aprovechar los datos satelitales para hacer afirmaciones convincentes basadas en datos del mundo real. Analizarás infografías existentes y utilizarás el concepto de matemáticas sociales para seleccionar tus áreas de enfoque. Las infografías finales se compartirán para recibir comentarios, y después de un tiempo para hacer revisiones, tendrás un recorrido por la galería donde mostrarás tu aprendizaje de la unidad y verás el trabajo de otros estudiantes. Esta es una oportunidad para ver la diversidad de enfoques posibles para compartir un mensaje importante basado en datos científicos.

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment and learn of the Irish Potato Famine, focusing on the importance of genetic diversity. They are given the unit challenge: to suggest ways in which humans can preserve variability and diversity among organisms. Students analyze a class graph showing their own genetic diversity, and come up with scientific questions about variation. After studying the anatomy of a seed, students study variability in lima beans, graphing their results. Explanations are made about the survival of lima beans under different conditions. Students begin thinking about how organisms get their traits.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Our journey begins with the story of the Irish Potato Famine, a tragic event that illustrates the importance of genetic diversity. This chapter will help us better understand our unit challenge, which is to promote genetic diversity in organisms. We'll first explore genetic diversity within our own class before diving into the world of seeds. Through experiments with lima beans, we'll grasp how various conditions affect growth and survival, highlighting the significance of adaptation. The knowledge gained in this chapter and the ones that follow will assist us in creating a documentary to emphasize the need for increased genetic diversity.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Nuestro viaje comienza con la historia de la Gran Hambruna Irlandesa, un evento trágico que ilustra la importancia de la diversidad genética. Este capítulo nos ayudará a comprender mejor nuestro desafío de unidad, que es promover la diversidad genética en los organismos. Primero exploraremos la diversidad genética dentro de nuestra propia clase antes de sumergirnos en el mundo de las semillas. A través de experimentos con frijoles lima, comprenderemos cómo diversas condiciones afectan el crecimiento y la supervivencia, destacando la importancia de la adaptación. El conocimiento adquirido en este capítulo y los siguientes nos ayudará a crear un documental para enfatizar la necesidad de aumentar la diversidad genética.

ChapterDescription: A presentation shows more about variation and how genes are passed from parent to offspring. Students model the inheritance of five traits by flipping coins to determine the features of the Critter Babies they create. Students analyze similarities and differences in the Critter Nursery and understand that genetic variation is increased through sexual reproduction.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we'll delve deeper into genetic variation and inheritance, employing tools like Punnett squares to visualize how traits are passed down. For a hands-on experience, we'll create our own Critter Babies, using a coin flip to determine their traits. This will allow us to appreciate the broad variation resulting from sexual reproduction and the role of beneficial traits in survival.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, profundizaremos en la variación y herencia genética, empleando herramientas como los cuadrados de Punnett para visualizar cómo se transmiten los rasgos. Para tener una experiencia práctica, crearemos nuestros propios Cachorros de Criaturas, usando una moneda para determinar sus características. Esto nos permitirá apreciar la amplia variación resultante de la reproducción sexual y el papel de los rasgos beneficiosos en la supervivencia.

ChapterDescription: Students looks at natural selection in a population of rock pocket mice and consider the meaning of the word 'fitness'. They research artificial selection and create a graphic organizer to compare natural and artificial selection. Students then build models to explore genetic engineering. They determine the benefits and risks of GMOs and present decisions to a hypothetical marketing company. Finally, students explore the interconnections of scientific knowledge, engineering, and technology, and complete Unit Concept Checkpoint #1.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we're off to explore the intriguing concept of natural selection, using rock pocket mice as a case study. We'll contrast this with artificial selection and delve into the realm of genetic engineering, assessing the potential benefits and risks of genetically modified organisms (GMOs). Applying our knowledge, we'll step into the shoes of a marketing company team member, making informed decisions about GMOs.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, nos adentraremos en el intrigante concepto de la selección natural, usando a los ratones de bolsillo de roca como caso de estudio. Contrastaremos esto con la selección artificial y exploraremos el mundo de la ingeniería genética, evaluando los posibles beneficios y riesgos de los organismos modificados genéticamente (OMG). Aplicando nuestro conocimiento, nos pondremos en los zapatos de un miembro del equipo de una empresa de marketing, tomando decisiones informadas sobre los OMG.

ChapterDescription: After an introduction to genetic mutations, students revisit the rock pocket mice and then look at the genetic mutation causing sickle cell disease. They build their own protein "molecules" to investigate the effects of changes in proteins. Then, using Scratch, students design and share models to show their findings. Students learn about the genetic and sporadic causes of ALS and factors that can trigger the disease. They investigate tissue engineering and the use of 3D-printed nanostructures. Finally, students build their own model of a nose. Unit Concept Checkpoint #2 explores the unit concepts.
ChapterDescriptionStident: We commence this chapter by examining how genetic mutations have shaped the rock pocket mice and proceed to understand a genetic mutation that causes sickle cell disease. We'll also explore another genetic disorder, ALS, and learn about the groundbreaking technology of tissue engineering. Hands-on activities and interactive models will solidify our understanding of these complex concepts, aiding us with the unit challenge - promoting the need to increase genetic diversity.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Comenzamos este capítulo examinando cómo las mutaciones genéticas han moldeado a los ratones de bolsillo de roca y procedemos a entender una mutación genética que causa la enfermedad falciforme. También exploraremos otro trastorno genético, la esclerosis lateral amiotrófica (ELA), y aprenderemos sobre la innovadora tecnología de la ingeniería de tejidos.
