Las actividades prácticas y los modelos interactivos solidificarán nuestra comprensión de estos conceptos complejos, ayudándonos con el desafío de unidad: promover la necesidad de aumentar la diversidad genética.

ChapterDescription: To begin, students review the causes of the Irish Potato Famine. They then begin the Unit 4 culminating activity with research into a chosen organism to discover how its genetic diversity is affected by artificial selection. Storyboarding and script writing follow. Students brainstorm solutions for increasing the genetic diversity of their organisms and then decide how best to promote their solutions. Finally, they film documentaries to be shown in a class film festival. The unit concludes with an assessment.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Ready for the unit challenge? We'll revisit the causes of the Irish Potato Famine, focusing on how genetic diversity could have altered the outcome. After thorough research, we'll storyboard and write scripts for our documentaries, focusing on methods to increase the genetic diversity of a chosen organism. After filming, we'll all enjoy a class film festival, where we share our final projects.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: ¿Listos para el desafío de unidad? Revisaremos las causas de la Gran Hambruna Irlandesa, centrándonos en cómo la diversidad genética podría haber alterado el resultado. Después de una investigación exhaustiva, elaboraremos guiones y storyboards para nuestros documentales, enfocándonos en métodos para aumentar la diversidad genética de un organismo elegido. Después de filmar, todos disfrutaremos de un festival de cine de clase, donde compartiremos nuestros proyectos finales.

ChapterDescription: After completing a pre-assessment, students receive the unit challenge: To propose sustainable transportation solutions. They look at facts about energy consumption to show the importance of their projects. A newsreel from the 1939 World's Fair is a stimulus for discussion about transportation of the past, present, and future. Students then study infographics to understand the needs of transportation users and conduct further research to look at future technologies in transport. Finally, students consider various energy sources and use patterns to think about a vehicle’s energy use.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Our unit begins with an exciting challenge: to propose sustainable transportation solutions. The journey starts by understanding the relevance of this task as we delve into the facts about energy consumption. We'll study transportation of the past, present, and future, with a fascinating peek at the 1939 World's Fair. Additionally, we'll examine the needs of transportation users and consider various energy sources, paving the way to our goal.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Nuestra unidad comienza con un emocionante desafío: proponer soluciones de transporte sostenible. El viaje comienza entendiendo la relevancia de esta tarea mientras exploramos los hechos sobre el consumo de energía. Estudiaremos el transporte del pasado, presente y futuro, con una fascinante mirada a la Feria Mundial de 1939. Además, examinaremos las necesidades de los usuarios de transporte y consideraremos varias fuentes de energía, allanando el camino hacia nuestro objetivo.

ChapterDescription: This chapter comprises a series of investigations into the relationship between kinetic energy, mass, and speed. Students learn about proportional relationships and explore the variables that drive kinetic energy. Using their experimental designs, they then focus on the relationship between kinetic energy and speed. Students discover linear and non-linear relationships. They compare their mass and speed graphs, and, in the final lesson, they are able to give an evidence-based explanation of the ways in which kinetic energy, mass, and speed are related.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Our exploration continues into the realm of kinetic energy, mass, and speed. Through a series of investigations, we'll uncover the proportional relationships and the variables that determine kinetic energy. The insights gathered from this chapter will guide us further in achieving our unit challenge.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Nuestra exploración continúa en el ámbito de la energía cinética, la masa y la velocidad. A través de una serie de investigaciones, descubriremos las relaciones proporcionales y las variables que determinan la energía cinética. Los conocimientos adquiridos en este capítulo nos guiarán aún más en la consecución de nuestro desafío de unidad.

ChapterDescription: Science and engineering combine as students build simple drag racers to observe differences in the motion between vehicles. Students observe friction as another factor affecting movement. After completing a series of student-driven investigations, students will be able to present evidence supporting claims about the effect of mass and force on acceleration.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Ready to become engineers? In this chapter, we'll build simple drag racers to understand differences in motion between vehicles and how factors like friction affect movement. The knowledge gained here will help us understand how to make transportation more efficient.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: ¿Listos para convertirnos en ingenieros? En este capítulo, construiremos simples coches de carrera para entender las diferencias en el movimiento entre vehículos y cómo los factores como la fricción afectan el movimiento. Los conocimientos adquiridos aquí nos ayudarán a comprender cómo hacer el transporte más eficiente.

ChapterDescription: In this chapter students investigate the bicycle, which uses less energy than any other mode of transportation so far examined. They look at the bicycle as a system with sub-systems, with energy flowing throughout the system. They also see how friction affects the movement of the bicycle. To investigate the absence of friction and to observe Newton's First Law of Motion, students make and test a simple hovercraft. Unit Concept Checkpoint #1 is completed in this chapter.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Our journey takes us to the bicycle, an efficient mode of transportation. We'll explore it as an energy system with sub-systems and understand the role of friction. We'll even get to observe Newton's First Law of Motion in action by making and testing a simple hovercraft!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Nuestro viaje nos lleva a la bicicleta, un modo eficiente de transporte. La exploraremos como un sistema de energía con sub-sistemas y entenderemos el papel de la fricción. ¡Incluso podremos observar la Primera Ley del Movimiento de Newton en acción al hacer y probar un sencillo aerodeslizador!

ChapterDescription: Students investigate magnetic fields and maglev trains. They use a rare earth magnet to measure and graph a magnetic force field. Teams build a mini hyperloop, and then plot the motion of the balls in different set-ups. Students construct electromagnets and a simple ammeter. They consider needs and energy efficiency as they select the optimal vehicle for different scenarios. The chapter concludes with Unit Concept Checkpoint #2.
ChapterDescriptionStident: Next, we'll delve into the world of magnetic fields and maglev trains. By creating a mini hyperloop, measuring a magnetic force field, and constructing electromagnets, we'll deepen our understanding of this advanced technology. This knowledge will aid us in selecting optimal vehicles for different scenarios as per their needs and energy efficiency.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: A continuación, nos adentraremos en el mundo de los campos magnéticos y los trenes maglev. Al crear un mini hyperloop, medir un campo magnético y construir electromagnetos, profundizaremos nuestra comprensión de esta tecnología avanzada. Este conocimiento nos ayudará a seleccionar los vehículos óptimos para diferentes escenarios según sus necesidades y eficiencia energética.

ChapterDescription: In the culminating project, students propose more sustainable solutions for future transportation. The class agrees upon a definition for sustainable transportation, and then students select a location and user group for their proposals. They carry out research and use CER to develop an argument to support the proposal. They review effective oral communication techniques to assist in the oral presentation, and finally, they present and discuss recommendations. The final day of the unit comprises a time for reflection and a post-assessment.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In our final chapter, we put everything we've learned to the test. We'll define sustainable transportation, select a location and user group for our proposals, and use our research skills to develop a solid argument. Then, it's time for the spotlight as we present our sustainable transportation solutions. And don’t be shy about sharing these proposals with others outside the classroom - this is how we start to create change in our community!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En nuestro capítulo final, pondremos todo lo que hemos aprendido a prueba. Definiremos el transporte sostenible, seleccionaremos una ubicación y un grupo de usuarios para nuestras propuestas y usaremos nuestras habilidades de investigación para desarrollar un argumento sólido. Luego, es hora del centro de atención mientras presentamos nuestras soluciones de transporte sostenible. ¡Y no dude en compartir estas propuestas con otros fuera del aula, así es como empezamos a crear cambios en nuestra comunidad!

ChapterDescription: Students take a pre-assessment and are introduced to the unit challenge: To design a sustainable community. The class agrees on a definition for sustainability and reviews previous Green Ninja challenges. Students note the infrastructure and geography of their community using Google Maps, and then explore the energy grid as an energy input/output system. Afterwards, they design water wheels to investigate potential energy and energy transformation. Finally, students write a CER statement and recognize how the potential energy of water varies with the position of objects within the system.
ChapterDescriptionStident: The challenge in this unit is to design a sustainable community, and Chapter 1 starts us off by exploring what sustainability means. A review of some of our previous Green Ninja challenges will provide inspiration. By examining our own community, we’ll explore its infrastructure and geography using the power of technology—Google Maps—to reveal the unique characteristics of our surroundings and how they can influence our sustainable energy choices. With this foundation, we delve into the energy grid as an energy input/output system. We’ll have fun designing a water wheel and witness firsthand how energy can transform from one form to another. We’ll practice expressing our scientific findings and conclusions in a clear and structured manner, and ponder how waterfalls can generate electricity.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: El desafío de esta unidad es diseñar una comunidad sostenible, y el Capítulo 1 comienza explorando lo que significa la sostenibilidad. Una revisión de algunos de nuestros desafíos previos de Green Ninja nos proporcionará inspiración. Al examinar nuestra propia comunidad, exploraremos su infraestructura y geografía utilizando la tecnología de Google Maps para revelar las características únicas de nuestro entorno y cómo pueden influir en nuestras opciones de energía sostenible. Con esta base, profundizaremos en la red de energía como un sistema de entrada/salida de energía. Nos divertiremos diseñando una rueda de agua y veremos de primera mano cómo la energía puede transformarse de una forma a otra. Practicaremos la expresión clara y estructurada de nuestros hallazgos y conclusiones científicas, y reflexionaremos sobre cómo las cascadas pueden generar electricidad.

ChapterDescription: Students focus on the Sun as a renewable energy source and analyze Sun path charts. Then they write CER statements explaining the gravitational interaction between Earth and the Sun. Demonstrations and discussion lead to the development of models explaining the Sun's changing position in the sky. Afterwards, students are challenged to create models explaining the seasons on Earth, and then expand their model to include the moon phases and eclipses. This chapter includes Unit Concept Checkpoint #1.
ChapterDescriptionStident: This chapter explores the Sun and how its energy can be used to help us create a more sustainable society. We start by asking, “How does the Sun's position change throughout the day and throughout the year?” We’ll develop models that explain why the Sun's position changes in the sky, discovering the reasons behind sunrise, sunset, and the changing seasons. We expand our models to include the moon, its phases, and even eclipses. By assembling this puzzle piece by piece, we’ll have a complete understanding of the celestial dance happening above us.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: Este capítulo explora el sol y cómo su energía puede ser utilizada para ayudarnos a crear una sociedad más sostenible. Comenzamos preguntándonos: '¿Cómo cambia la posición del sol a lo largo del día y del año?' Desarrollaremos modelos que expliquen por qué la posición del sol cambia en el cielo, descubriendo las razones detrás del amanecer, el atardecer y los cambios de estación. Ampliaremos nuestros modelos para incluir la luna, sus fases e incluso los eclipses. Al armar esta pieza por pieza, tendremos una comprensión completa del baile celestial que ocurre sobre nosotros.

ChapterDescription: Students research energy storage systems, then create and share posters. A quiz covers the concepts of potential energy and a class lexicon of sustainability is created to generate ideas for the unit challenge. Students then receive instructions for the challenge of designing a sustainable community. They form teams and begin writing proposals for their sustainable solutions. This chapter contains Unit Concept Checkpoint #2.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this chapter, we’ll explore energy storage, which is a critical part of designing a sustainable community. Since the sun isn’t shining all the time, we’ll need to figure out how to store the solar energy for times when the sun isn’t shining, like at night! We’ll then prepare for our unit challenge by exploring the concept of a lexicon of sustainability.
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo, exploraremos el almacenamiento de energía, que es una parte crítica para diseñar una comunidad sostenible. Dado que el sol no brilla todo el tiempo, tendremos que descubrir cómo almacenar la energía solar para momentos en que el sol no brille, ¡como durante la noche! Luego, nos prepararemos para nuestro desafío de unidad explorando el concepto de un léxico de sostenibilidad.

ChapterDescription: Students develop proposals for sustainable solutions and contribute to a class map. They research with a focus on existing local infrastructure related to their solutions. Then they brainstorm ideas for their prototypes while considering what materials they will need. Afterwards they give presentations which include written reports, the map display, and the prototypes of their sustainable solutions. To conclude, there is time to celebrate efforts and achievements. A final assessment gauges student understanding of the unit.
ChapterDescriptionStident: In this final chapter, we’ve reached the point where we can work on our unit challenge. As a class, we’ll design a model for a sustainable community, with smaller groups of students each responsible for creating designs for different parts of a community, such as where the energy comes from, how people move around, and how homes are designed. To kickstart your design process, you will need to consider local infrastructure and indicate your project location on a class map. You will bring your vision to life by building a prototype of your design, carefully considering which materials will best suit your project. The final presentation comprises your written report, the map display, and the prototype of your sustainable solution. This comprehensive showcase will demonstrate the depth of your research, the creativity of your design, and the thoughtfulness of your approach. If we can first envision what a sustainable community looks like and justify this vision with science, then we can help make such a vision actually happen!
ChapterDescriptionStidentSpanish: En este capítulo final, hemos llegado al punto en el que podemos trabajar en nuestro desafío de unidad. Como clase, diseñaremos un modelo para una comunidad sostenible, con grupos más pequeños de estudiantes responsables de crear diseños para diferentes partes de una comunidad, como de dónde proviene la energía, cómo se mueven las personas y cómo se diseñan las viviendas. Para iniciar su proceso de diseño, deberán considerar la infraestructura local e indicar la ubicación del proyecto en un mapa de clase. Darán vida a su visión construyendo un prototipo de su diseño, considerando cuidadosamente qué materiales se adaptarán mejor a su proyecto. La presentación final comprende su informe escrito, la pantalla del mapa y el prototipo de su solución sostenible. Esta exhibición completa demostrará la profundidad de su investigación, la creatividad de su diseño y la reflexión de su enfoque. Si podemos primero visualizar cómo se ve una comunidad sostenible y justificar esta visión con la ciencia, ¡entonces podemos ayudar a que esta visión se haga realidad!
